elements.text: PART ONE
SCENE 1: INT. TARDIS
CONTINUOUS FROM END OF ‘MISTFALL’: TARDIS LURCHING ABOUT,
EXPLOSIONS, ALARMS, DOCTOR RUSHING ROUND CONSOLE.
(ACROSS OTHERS) I can’t get these systems to respond!
(ACROSS OTHERS) Doctor, what are we supposed to do?
(ACROSS OTHERS) Won’t someone tell me what’s happening?!
(WRESTLING CONTROLS) Would everyone please calm down, I’m trying to concentrate!
SHUT UP. TARDIS MALFUNCTIONING AND ALARMS ONGOING.
Thank you! Nyssa, see what you can do about the hull phasing. The controls over there should do... something.
Yes, Doctor. (USES CONTROLS, SOME ALARMS STOP)
At last! — So we’re alright to fly without this stabiliser Solus stole from the TARDIS?
Not really, no.
What’s that mean, ‘not really’?
That’s not important right now.
The point is, without the interface stabiliser we’ll never get out of E-Space.
Which is why I’m trying to pick up the ion trail from Solus’s spaceship.
But he could have gone anywhere!
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 3
E-Space isn’t that big. Not compared to N-Space.
We've lost a hairpin in a swimming pool, rather than an ocean.
It’s still a very large swimming [pool.]
ALERT SOUND.
Ah-ha!
Is that it? You’ve found it?
More than that, I’ve picked up the end point of the ion trail.
So his spaceship’s landed?
Or it’s exploded.
(MANIPULATING CONTROLS) Strange, there seems to be some kind of barrier between us and its location...
(USING CONTROLS) Doctor, I’ve re-routed some internal systems to compensate for the loss of dimensional shell integrity.
You did what with the what?
Thank you, Nyssa. We can attempt a landing, at least. Hold on, everyone...
MATERIALISATION STARTS.
‘Attempt’? What do you mean, ‘attempt’?
He means — either we land, or we crash!
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 4
SCENE 2: EXT. ICE PLAIN
STUTTERING MATERIALISATION COMPLETES. DOORS OPEN, CREW
OUT ONTO SNOW-COVERED ICY TERRAIN, COUGHING.
Give it a few minutes for the smoke to clear.
Are you kidding? That thing needs a complete overhaul.
She’s right, Doctor. It’s too dangerous to go back inside without the stabiliser. The outer shell could become completely detached from the internal dimensions.
Yes.. and without that seal, she’s leaking energy into the vortex. We need to find that stabiliser while we’ve still enough power to leave E-Space.
You could have picked a more hospitable place to land. Ice, more ice and oh, what’s over there? Mountains made of ice.
Whatever planet we’re on, you found the North Pole. It’s freezing!
I was rather more concerned with not getting vaporised by an energy induction barrier than checking the local weather forecast. Here, Nyssa. Take this.
NYSSA A TRACKER, ACTIVATES SCANNING AND BEEPING.
(TAKING IT) The tracker from the console.
It’s tuned to the stabiliser’s energy signature. There aren’t many things the TARDIS will recognise as its own in this universe, let alone on this planet.
It’s picking something up three kilometres in... this direction.
Good. We’ll be there in no time at all.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 5
The TARDIS scanner showed life-signs that way too. A settlement of some kind.
Excellent. (SETTING OFF) A brisk walk will keep us warm.
In the snow. Oh joy.
THEY START WALKING.
Come on Turlough, where’s your pioneering spirit?
Back in my room. With a hot cup of cocoa.
Look. In the distance. There’s something big half-buried in the
ice.
Is it.. wreckage? I can’t tell through the snowstorm.
Whatever’s falling on it isn’t snow. It’s black.
CRACKS BEHIND. THEY TURN BACK TOWARDS TARDIS.
Now what?
Doctor! Look!
The ice around the TARDIS.. it’s breaking up!
CRACKING ICE.
Keep away from the cracks, all of you!
CRACK AS ICE SPLITS AND THE TARDIS SLIDES BENEATH.
The TARDIS...!
It’s gone under!
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 6
SCENE 3: EXT. ICE PLAIN, FURTHER OFF
6 x HORSES (TWO PULLING CART) SLOWING ON FROZEN TUNDRA.
(PULLING UP HER HORSE) Whoa..! — There is poor hunting here today, Jesper. The snowbeasts know we are coming. Either that, or black snow falls and they keep themselves hidden.
One moment... my lady.
DISMOUNTS, SCRAPES SNOW.
There are tracks. The beasts gathered here. But something drew them off, to the east.
TURNS HORSE.
There is no tracker like you in the kingdom, Jesper. (CALLING)
Turnabout, hunters! Turn east!
Look east, your majesty. What do you see?
The shadow clouds.
You were right. It is another day of darkness. The black snows fall again.
Then let us take our prize before it is stolen. Come on!
GALLOP OFF.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 7
SCENE 4: EXT. ICE PLAIN
OVER ICE. A FEW CRACKS AND FALLING FRAGMENTS.
What are we going to do?
One thing at a time. The TARDIS isn’t far below the surface.
Yeah, I can still see the lamp.
Stay away from the edge, Tegan.
If there are people in that settlement, they might be willing to help haul it out.
Before we can do anything, we need that stabiliser. (DECIDES) Come on.
We’re leaving the TARDIS behind?
We don’t have much choice.
Turlough’s right. We can’t leave until I can repair her anyway. Our first priority is that missing component.
NYSSA’S TRACKER BEEPS.
At least we know it’s not too far away.
You know what else isn’t far away?
GROWLING, OFF.
They’re like wolves!
Only twice the size.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 8
They’re so white...
No wonder we didn’t see them coming.
This is all very well, but shouldn’t we get a move on?
QUICKENS HIS PACE.
(ABRUPTLY) Don’t run! If they’re anything like Earth wolves, they’1l sense panic and attack.
BEEPS. A SNARL IN RESPONSE.
Best switch that off for now, Nyssa.
(SWITCHING SCANNER OFF) It’s this way.
A brisk walk, remember.
THEY CARRY ON WALKING. SNOWBEAST SNARLS, OFF.
Maybe a little brisker than that.
THEY WALK OFF QUICKLY.
SNAPPING AND GROWLING, START SLOWLY AFTER THEM.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 9
SCENE 5: EXT. ICE PLAIN, FURTHER OFF
HORSES ON FROZEN TUNDRA SLOW.
(PULLING UP HER HORSE) Hold. There. Do you see?
THE HUNTING PARTY STOPS.
(CALLING BACK) Snowbeasts. The pack is on the move together.
It is unusual for so many to be out in the daytime.
(FROM AHEAD) Come here, my lady. Look beyond the end of the ice-mountain pass. See what has drawn their hunger?
INGER’S HORSE TROTS FURTHER TO JOIN JESPER.
More strangers? Four of them. Such odd clothing.
Why have they come here? Do you think they know of the other?
They are brave or foolish to taunt the snowbeasts this way. I see no weapons...
Then they cannot harm us.
Nor can they protect themselves.
SPURS HER HORSE.
(CALLING) With me! We shall catch ourselves something extra today!
THEY GALLOP OFF.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 10
SCENE 6: EXT. ICE PLAIN
SNARLING, SNAPPING SNOWBEASTS CLOSING. TARDIS CREW HURRYING
SNOW.
(WALKING QUICKLY) Walking isn’t working, Doctor. They’re gaining on us!
(WALKING QUICKLY) You’re right. Maybe we should... in fact.. Run!
THEY SET OFF RUNNING. THE SNOWBEASTS GROWL AND GIVE CHASE.
(RUNNING) Where are we going?
(RUNNING) There’s a fissure in the ice-wall ahead. It looks too narrow for those creatures, if we can squeeze inside...
(RUNNING) Good thinking, Nyssa. Come on!
GALLOPING HORSES EMERGE FROM PASS,
SHOOTING IN FROM DISTANCE.
(RIDING, CALLING) Yah! Fire!
Everybody! Get down!
THE TARDIS CREW DROP. ARROWS HIT SEVERAL SNOWBEASTS. THEY YELP AND FALL. OTHERS SNARL AND RUN OFF.
What the-?
INGER AND HUNTERS GALLOP UP.
Good shooting Jesper! We have brought down half the pack! You men. Finish them off. We shall not return to my mother’s castle empty-handed after all.
DISMOUNT AND KILL SNOWBEASTS UNDER FOLLOWING.
(GETTING UP) Thank you! Very kind of you to come to our aid. The thing is, we’re a little lost!
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 11
TROTS UP.
You are in Isenfel. I cannot welcome you. That is the task of my mother. The Queen.
YELP OF SNOWBEAST KILLED.
Is she a fan of bloodsports too?
You could be a little more grateful, Tegan. Those things meant business.
Load the carcasses onto the cart. (TURNING HORSE) Jesper, Torsten, Ivan. Over here. We shall each take a passenger.
APPROACH.
Jesper. You take this man.
Yes, my lady. (HELPING DOCTOR) Here, sir. Take my hand.
(CLIMBING UP) Thank you. I’m the Doctor and-
(INTERRUPTING) I said save your introductions. The women can ride with these two huntsmen. (TO HUNTSMEN) Help them up.
NYSSA AND TEGAN MOUNT OTHER HORSES THROUGH:
(CLIMBING UP) Thank you.
(CLIMBING UP) I can manage. I’ve had quite a bit of practice recently...
(CALLING) Hold tight, everyone. And what about-
INTERRUPTING) I will take this one. (TROTS TOWARDS TURLOUGH
Your name?
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL)
Turlough. (CLIMBING UP) Thank you... descent, Princess...?
Inger. And you? With your hair the What manner of man are you?
A cold one.
(SPURRING HORSE) Yah!
TROT OFF.
Page 12
I presume you’re of royal
shade of glowing embers.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 13
SCENE 7: INT. PALACE, BALANCING CHAMBER
WHIRRING, TICKING LIKE CLOCKWORK AND GEIGER COUNTERS INSIDE AN
UNDERGROUND ICE CHAMBER.
(MUTTERING TO SELF) The balance is disturbed. Too many. There are too many...
TICKING CONTROLS. A TINKLING OF THE HOLOGRAPHIC DISPLAY ACTIVATING.
Nine thousand five hundred and eighty-six. No, nine thousand five hundred and eighty-five...
TINKLING HOLOGRAPHIC DISPLAY.
Now the numbers are falling. But they are still too high. The energies are in flux. The digits are not constant. I must know... How many?
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 14
SCENE 8: INT. PALACE, HALL
DOORS OPENED. FOOTSTEPS ON ICY FLOORS. A PALACE MADE OF ICE WITH GLASSY FLOORS AND SLIDING, SCRAPING DOORS.
Wait here. You will be presented to the royal house.
EXITS ALONG CORRIDOR. TARDIS CREW PACE IN HUGE ICE HALL.
Talk about a snow queen. This whole palace, it’s carved out of ice.
It’s beautiful.
I’d sooner have central heating.
While we’re waiting... Nyssa, try the tracker again. See if we’re any closer to our missing stabiliser?
(SEARCHING) Oh no... I must have dropped it when we ran from those creatures!
Ah. That’s not the best news. Not to worry. I’m sure we’ll think of something...
FOOTSTEPS IN CORRIDOR AS KARLINA AND ENTOURAGE APPROACH.
Someone’s coming!
Now smile, everyone. Be polite. It’s amazing how far it can get you.
KARLINA AND INGER ENTER WITH COURTIERS.
You are all welcome to Isenfel. For now.
Mother. These strangers were in the outer wilds. Like the other. And there was more black snow.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 15
Visitors have been a rarity in the past. But not of late, it seems. We welcome any enlightenment they might bring.
Excuse me, your highness. Do you mean to say you’ve had other guests recently?
Questions. So soon? Before we have exchanged introductions?
Of course. I’m sorry.
Be polite you said.
(ANNOUNCING) My mother. Queen Karlina of Isenfel.
Your majesty. I’m the Doctor. This is Tegan, Nyssa and Turlough. My friends and I are most grateful for Princess Inger’s assistance. And your kind hospitality.

(WALKING AROUND THEM) Doctor? A man of learning? Such a range of aspects you have. The boy with his fiery crown. And the women, so dark. So different. You, Doctor, you are more like a man of Isenfel. Except in your unseemly haste.
I apologise again, your majesty. It’s been rather a difficult day.
Do not concern yourself. We take no offence. — We will offer you accommodation. We may talk on any subject you wish at our feast tonight.
I.. look forward to it. Thank you.
SWEEPS OUT
(CLOSE) She seems friendly enough.
(CLOSE) You call that friendly?
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 16
(CLOSE) Compared to some of the monarchs I’ve met, she was positively chummy.
Do you think she can help us?
Let’s hope so.
(APPROACHING) This way. Our servants will take you to an ante- chamber while rooms are prepared.
Thank you. Through here, everyone.
THEY WALK TO CORRIDOR. INGER CATCHES TURLOUGH.
One moment, Sir Turlough. —
What? Oh. Yes?
I shall find you later. I have arranged a place for you at my table. We sit with the huntsmen.
Oh... er.. Thank you.
WALKS OFF.
You’ve done all right for yourself. A princess!
Some people just recognise good breeding.
Breeding? Ha! She’d eat you alive.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 17
SCENE 9: INT. PALACE CORRIDOR
WALKS WITH GUARDS. ROMY ENTERS CORRIDOR.
(CALLING) Our servant! Madam Romy! Here!
(APPROACHING) Yes, your Majesty.
Open up the lower chambers. We would use the rooms down there for our guests.
(WORRIED) My lady. Those chambers have not been used since your father was alive. Would it not [be better-]
(INTERRUPTING) Then it is time they saw some life.
Sorry, my lady. I did not mean to speak out of turn.
See that it is done.
Yes, your Majesty.
CARRIES ON PAST.
MUSIC SEGUE:
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 18
SCENE 10: INT. PALACE, BALANCING CHAMBER
WHIRRING, TICKING B/G
Equilibrium is disturbed. This cannot be sustained.
CLOCKWORK CONTROLS. TINKLING HOLOGRAMS ACTIVATED.
Tell me. What must be done? How many to restore the balance?
DOOR SLIDES OPEN. KARLINA ENTERS. DOOR CLOSES BEHIND
You talk to your machines again, Balancer Skarsgard?
It is my duty and my function, your highness. For the stability of the kingdom. Isenfel be constant.
Isenfel be constant. We have more visitors. Yet not one appeared throughout the whole of my father’s reign, nor the reign of his father before him.
I know, my lady.
Now it seems we are inundated. Why? Is it a sign? Is there some... change to come?
That is why I consult my machines. They will have the answer soon. They always do.
I hope they do not say we have done wrong. We try to rule a fair and equitable kingdom.
It is no fault of yours, my lady. It is the Balancing. That is all.
Yes. But sometimes...
TAPPING ON ICE DOOR.
(OUTSIDE) Mother! Are you in there?
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 19
(CALLING) Yes, daughter?
SLIDES OPEN.
The table is not yet set, but this ‘Doctor’ is already in the great hall. He asks many questions.
I sense he has an inquiring mind.
The other guests are starting to arrive.
Then we shall not keep them waiting. Skarsgard?
The Balancing will reveal itself presently. I shall keep you informed, my lady.
(EXITING) Very good. Accompany us to our chambers, Inger. You might at least brush your hair.
ICE-DOOR CLOSES, KARLINA AND INGER DEPART ALONG CORRIDOR.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 20
SCENE 11: INT. PALACE KITCHENS
CARRIES A BOX OF SUPPLIES IN. KITCHEN ACTIVITY, PLATES,
RATTLING B/G. ROMY WALKS BACK AND FORTH LOADING PLATES ON
THROUGHOUT.
Where do you want the sweetmeats, Madam Romy?
(COMING OVER) There. By the ovens. Since when have you called me Madam?
(CARRYING BOX) I can show my wife respect, can I not? (PUTS
BOX)
(KINDLY) Only when you want something. Stay out of the way. And away from the food!
Some of those courtiers can spare a little from their plates, I dare say.
MAKES TO TAKE FOOD. ROMY SLAPS HIS HAND AWAY.
Hush, Jesper. Leave them. (CLOSE) Do not worry, I have set some aside for the children.
(CLOSE) Good. I will collect it later. I was there when we found the new strangers, you know.
(PUTTING PLATES DOWN) I heard there are four of them? So many...
I know... We must hope the Queen makes her decision quickly.
(TAKING HIM TO ONE SIDE, CLOSER) Jesper. Queen Karlina has ordered them housed in the lower corridors.
(GRUNT OF DISAPPROVAL, CLOSE) Then you had better keep a close eye on them.
I shall, husband. Now go.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 21
(LEAVING) I am gone!
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 22
SCENE 12: INT. PALACE CORRIDOR (CONTINUOUS)
WALKING, SKARSGARD APPROACHES.
(WALKING) Balancer Skarsgard. Not often we see you abroad in the servants’ quarters.
WALKING) My duties take me wherever I am needed. (STOPS
Perhaps you can help. I am looking for the steward.
(STOPS) He’s in the kitchens. (BEAT) May I enquire...?
You may not.
Of course. It is not my business. (MOVES ON)
(CALLING AFTER) Sir Jesper.
(STOPPING) Yes, Lord Balancer?
Apologies if I seem abrupt. You do know the Balancer serves only the greater good.
Yes, my lord.
You met the strangers. What did you make of them?
Peculiar-looking. But harmless. One has the appearance of a man of Isenfel. But the others... I’ve never seen the like.
Thank you. I can tell you that today I am occupied with many things. Census histories. Service records. I need to prepare.
Of course. Your work is never-ending is it not, Balancer?
Too true, Sir Jesper. I shall not detain you. Isenfel be constant.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 23
WALKS OFF TO KITCHEN
Isenfel be constant. (SOTTO, BITTER) But for some, things end all too soon. Balancer Skarsgard.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 24
SCENE 13: INT. PALACE CORRIDOR
WALKS ALONG CORRIDOR.
(TO SELF) I wonder what’s for dinner... (SEES INGER) Ah.
Sir Turlough! (APPROACHES) You have lost your handmaidens?
My... er..? Oh, I see. They take rather a long time to get ready. You know what girls are like. (BEAT) Or maybe you don’t.
Are they promised to you? Either of them?
(LAUGHS) Please, no! I‘ve done nothing to deserve that.
You are unusual, Sir Turlough.
I’ll take that as a compliment. (BEAT) I should warn you, I-.
(INTERRUPTING) Come with me on a night—hunt. After the feast.
Hunting... what?
The snowbeasts of course. They like the light of the stars. That is when most are abroad.
Ah. Tempting as it is to venture into the freezing cold, looking for monsters who want to rip me to shreds, I think I'd rather get some rest.
You play the game, Sir Turlough. You will be persuaded. I am sure.
WALKS OFF
(SOTTO) No. I really won’t.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 25
SCENE 14: INT. ANOTHER PALACE CORRIDOR
WALKING ALONG ICY CORRIDOR
(TO SELF) Why is it they always put the bathroom miles away from anywhere [useful...?]
CHILD’S CRY, VERY DISTANT — DISTORTED BY ECHOING CORRIDORS.
What was that? — Hello? Hello...?
HURRIES ALONG CORRIDOR TOWARDS TEGAN
(APPROACHING) Are you lost, mistress?
I was just on my way back from the... oh, never mind.
Follow me back to your room, mistress. One can easily become lost in the corridors.
LEADS TEGAN BACK
(FOLLOWING) Yeah, it’s like a maze down here. All these ice tunnels. You’d think it’d feel much colder.
(WALKING) The palace is warmed by the energies of Isenfel. It is protected.
(WALKING) Protected? Protected from what?
(APPROACHING FROM OFF) Tegan! — There you are.
It would be best if you both returned to your chambers. You will be summoned to banquet in the great hall shortly.
Then you will eat. (ALL STOP OUTSIDE A CHAMBER.) Here is your room, Mistress.
Thank you. (TO TEGAN) Where did you go?
I thought I heard something.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 26
You shouldn’t go wandering off. We’ve no idea what animals they might be keeping here.
It wasn’t an animal. It sounded human.
(COVERING) There are many strange sounds in the lower tunnels. The warming and the cooling... The movement of the air can play tricks on the ears. (BEAT) Is there anything else, my mistresses?
You don’t have to keep calling us that. We’ve got names.
(UNSURE) I’m sorry, my lady. I don’t mean to offend.
That’s all right, go about your business. We shall wait to be summoned.
Thank you, young mistress. (WALKS OFF)
I can’t bear all this bowing and scraping. It just isn’t right.
That’s your problem, Tegan. These people have a very clearly defined place in their world. We shouldn’t confuse them. We don’t have any idea of the rules.
You think they’re happy being slaves?
No. I mean we don’t know that they are slaves. And we don’t want to disturb the order of things. We just want to leave with as little fuss as possible.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 27
SCENE 15: INT. PALACE HALL [SOME TIME LATER]
FADE UP. MUSICAL ENTERTAINMENT, ICE FLUTES, NORDIC MEDIEVAL STYLE. MUSIC ENDS. POLITE APPLAUSE.
Thank you. Now. We may eat.
Your flautists are very accomplished, your highness. It’s no mean feat to play an instrument while it melts.
That is the skill of all in Isenfel. To make the most of our environment while maintaining its form.
Interesting. Have your people been settled here long?
Many generations. Balancer Skarsgard keeps the records. Perhaps in a few years I will be content to look over the past.
I’m sure your dotage is a long way off.
You flatter me, Doctor. But not all on Isenfel are able to enjoy so long a life. (BEAT) Your wards have arrived.
My...2 Oh, yes.
TEGAN AND NYSSA APPROACH TABLE
(CALLING) Join us, ladies.
(SOTTO) Why do I feel like I’ve come to an ABBA tribute night?
What does your friend say?
She was just noting how your people have a very distinct look. (TO TEGAN) Polite, remember, Tegan.
I’m only saying. All the blonde hair, blue eyes.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 28
Recessive traits can become common when communities are confined in one area. A small genetic pool, specially adapted to their environment.
But don’t forget, even across different humanoid species hereditary markers can vary considerably. (BEAT) And as we’re in E-Space, we11...
(INTERRUPTS) Such language! Such ideas! You are scientists? All of you?
Not me. I’m just a tourist.
Sit down, Tegan. — Thank you, your highness.
NYSSA AND TEGAN SIT. SERVANTS BRING PLATES.
Please, eat. And afterwards, you will meet our Royal Balancer.
Balancer?
I imagine he’s some kind of accountant. Keeper of the royal records. Holder of the purse strings. That sort of thing. Am I right, your majesty?
You may call me Karlina, Doctor. You have a curious nature, I sense.
Oh yes. The Doctor’s nosy all right.
Tuck in, why don’t you, Tegan?
(WHISPER, TO NYSSA) Tuck in? To what? I’ve seen bigger drumsticks on a kookaburra.
(CLOSE) You saw what it’s like outside. I’m surprised they can farm anything.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 29
I think I’1l stick with the salad. (PICKS UP HANDFUL OF DRY REEDS) Or rather... the dried leaves?
(ACROSS TABLE) The snowrushes are most nourishing. Their
flavour is bitter, but there are strong energies within.
(TO KARLINA) Thank you, your majesty.
(TO KARLINA) It all looks very... appetising, your highness.
LOADS SOME FOOD ON HER PLATE.
(TO NYSSA) At least Turlough seems to be enjoying himself over
on the huntsmen’s table. With his new girlfriend...
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 30
SCENE 16: INT. PALACE HALL, INGER’S TABLE (CONTINUOUS)
B/G. INGER POURS A GOBLET.
More mead, Sir Turlough? My mother keeps a fine cellar.
Thank you. Tell me more about this... hunt of yours?
We venture out, under cover of the Isenfel night. The snowbeasts prowl in greater number once darkness falls.
Snowbeasts... Those wolf-things. Is the hunting just for sport, or do you...
(INTERRUPTING) We hunt the beasts. And so we kill them. What would be the point of it otherwise? They must be culled.
(EATING) I see. And what do you do with them afterwards?
We wear their skins. Burn their fat in candles. (BEAT) You are
eating the flesh of one of them now.
(SPITTING OUT FOOD) What? I thought it was chicken!
What is... chicken?
Never mind. I’ve suddenly lost my appetite.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 31
SCENE 17: INT. PALACE HALL (CONTINUOUS)
PLATES AND FOOD BEING PASSED. HUBBUB OF COURTIERS AT TABLE.
Thank you again, Karlina. I hope we shan’t impose on you for too long.
Stay as long as you wish, Doctor. Your company is most illuminating. We have little ‘science’ here.
It’s not the be-all and end-all. I’m sure, given time, your people’s skills will develop.
We have had much time already. But the mysteries of our world are still largely unknown.
Well, there’s no rush. You’ve music, culture, craftsmanship. Above all, you too seem to have a healthy sense of curiosity. It’s a very good start.
Nothing will change here. Not for a long while.
What makes you say that? (BEAT) Your daughter mentioned a stranger when we arrived. You said Isenfel does not have many visitors?
It is a very rare occurrence.
But there was one recently? Before us?
A vessel appeared. A thing from the stars.
Yes. We noticed some debris on the ice.
We saw its falling lights, several nights ago.
And that’s how this stranger arrived?
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 32
A man was found in the wreckage. You must understand. We meet very few travellers from... outside. A handful over several generations. But now... you are so many.
This man’s name, was it ‘Solus’?
Yes. I believe it was. Balancer Skarsgard was the one who tended him.
He was unwell?
Alas, he was terribly injured when his carriage crashed into the ice.
He was badly injured before the crash — er, quite possibly. Tell me, is this Solus still here? Somewhere in the palace?
Unfortunately, his wounds meant he could not survive.
I see. (BEAT) Was he carrying anything? A glowing red crystal, perhaps?
You would have to ask the Balancer these questions. (STANDING) Our musicians are ready once again. (CALLING) Please. Play for our guests.
CLAPS. MUSICAL ENTERTAINMENT BEGINS AGAIN.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 33
SCENE 18: INT. PALACE CORRIDOR, OUTSIDE HALL
FEASTING AND MUSIC IN HALL, OFF. SKARSGARD LEADING 4 x SERVANTS
(INC ROMY) TO STOP.
You four, wait here a moment. Prepare yourselves for your Queen.

TEGAN: (FOLLOWING) Yeah, it’s like a maze down here. All these ice tunnels. You’d think it’d feel much colder.
ROMY: (WALKING) The palace is warmed by the energies of Isenfel. It is protected.
TEGAN: (WALKING) Protected? Protected from what?
NYSSA: (APPROACHING FROM OFF) Tegan! — There you are.
ROMY: It would be best if you both returned to your chambers. You will be summoned to banquet in the great hall shortly.
ROMY: Then you will eat. (ALL STOP OUTSIDE A CHAMBER.) Here is your room, Mistress.
NYSSA: Thank you. (TO TEGAN) Where did you go?
TEGAN: I thought I heard something.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 26
NYSSA: You shouldn’t go wandering off. We’ve no idea what animals they might be keeping here.
TEGAN: It wasn’t an animal. It sounded human.
ROMY: (COVERING) There are many strange sounds in the lower tunnels. The warming and the cooling... The movement of the air can play tricks on the ears. (BEAT) Is there anything else, my mistresses?
TEGAN: You don’t have to keep calling us that. We’ve got names.
ROMY: (UNSURE) I’m sorry, my lady. I don’t mean to offend.
NYSSA: That’s all right, go about your business. We shall wait to be summoned.
ROMY: Thank you, young mistress. (WALKS OFF)
TEGAN: I can’t bear all this bowing and scraping. It just isn’t right.
NYSSA: That’s your problem, Tegan. These people have a very clearly defined place in their world. We shouldn’t confuse them. We don’t have any idea of the rules.
TEGAN: You think they’re happy being slaves?
NYSSA: No. I mean we don’t know that they are slaves. And we don’t want to disturb the order of things. We just want to leave with as little fuss as possible.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 27
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 15: INT. PALACE HALL [SOME TIME LATER]
DOCTOR WHO: FADE UP. MUSICAL ENTERTAINMENT, ICE FLUTES, NORDIC MEDIEVAL STYLE. MUSIC ENDS. POLITE APPLAUSE.
KARLINA: Thank you. Now. We may eat.
DOCTOR: Your flautists are very accomplished, your highness. It’s no mean feat to play an instrument while it melts.
KARLINA: That is the skill of all in Isenfel. To make the most of our environment while maintaining its form.
DOCTOR: Interesting. Have your people been settled here long?
KARLINA: Many generations. Balancer Skarsgard keeps the records. Perhaps in a few years I will be content to look over the past.
DOCTOR: I’m sure your dotage is a long way off.
KARLINA: You flatter me, Doctor. But not all on Isenfel are able to enjoy so long a life. (BEAT) Your wards have arrived.
DOCTOR: My...2 Oh, yes.
DOCTOR: TEGAN AND NYSSA APPROACH TABLE
KARLINA: (CALLING) Join us, ladies.
TEGAN: (SOTTO) Why do I feel like I’ve come to an ABBA tribute night?
KARLINA: What does your friend say?
DOCTOR: She was just noting how your people have a very distinct look. (TO TEGAN) Polite, remember, Tegan.
TEGAN: I’m only saying. All the blonde hair, blue eyes.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 28
NYSSA: Recessive traits can become common when communities are confined in one area. A small genetic pool, specially adapted to their environment.
DOCTOR: But don’t forget, even across different humanoid species hereditary markers can vary considerably. (BEAT) And as we’re in E-Space, we11...
KARLINA: (INTERRUPTS) Such language! Such ideas! You are scientists? All of you?
TEGAN: Not me. I’m just a tourist.
NYSSA: Sit down, Tegan. — Thank you, your highness.
NYSSA: NYSSA AND TEGAN SIT. SERVANTS BRING PLATES.
KARLINA: Please, eat. And afterwards, you will meet our Royal Balancer.
TEGAN: Balancer?
DOCTOR: I imagine he’s some kind of accountant. Keeper of the royal records. Holder of the purse strings. That sort of thing. Am I right, your majesty?
KARLINA: You may call me Karlina, Doctor. You have a curious nature, I sense.
TEGAN: Oh yes. The Doctor’s nosy all right.
DOCTOR: Tuck in, why don’t you, Tegan?
TEGAN: (WHISPER, TO NYSSA) Tuck in? To what? I’ve seen bigger drumsticks on a kookaburra.
NYSSA: (CLOSE) You saw what it’s like outside. I’m surprised they can farm anything.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 29
TEGAN: I think I’1l stick with the salad. (PICKS UP HANDFUL OF DRY REEDS) Or rather... the dried leaves?
KARLINA: (ACROSS TABLE) The snowrushes are most nourishing. Their
KARLINA: flavour is bitter, but there are strong energies within.
TEGAN: (TO KARLINA) Thank you, your majesty.
NYSSA: (TO KARLINA) It all looks very... appetising, your highness.
NYSSA: LOADS SOME FOOD ON HER PLATE.
TEGAN: (TO NYSSA) At least Turlough seems to be enjoying himself over
TEGAN: on the huntsmen’s table. With his new girlfriend...
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 30
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 16: INT. PALACE HALL, INGER’S TABLE (CONTINUOUS)
FEASTING: B/G. INGER POURS A GOBLET.
INGER: More mead, Sir Turlough? My mother keeps a fine cellar.
TURLOUGH: Thank you. Tell me more about this... hunt of yours?
INGER: We venture out, under cover of the Isenfel night. The snowbeasts prowl in greater number once darkness falls.
TURLOUGH: Snowbeasts... Those wolf-things. Is the hunting just for sport, or do you...
INGER: (INTERRUPTING) We hunt the beasts. And so we kill them. What would be the point of it otherwise? They must be culled.
TURLOUGH: (EATING) I see. And what do you do with them afterwards?
INGER: We wear their skins. Burn their fat in candles. (BEAT) You are
INGER: eating the flesh of one of them now.
TURLOUGH: (SPITTING OUT FOOD) What? I thought it was chicken!
INGER: What is... chicken?
TURLOUGH: Never mind. I’ve suddenly lost my appetite.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 31
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 17: INT. PALACE HALL (CONTINUOUS)
DOCTOR WHO: PLATES AND FOOD BEING PASSED. HUBBUB OF COURTIERS AT TABLE.
DOCTOR: Thank you again, Karlina. I hope we shan’t impose on you for too long.
KARLINA: Stay as long as you wish, Doctor. Your company is most illuminating. We have little ‘science’ here.
DOCTOR: It’s not the be-all and end-all. I’m sure, given time, your people’s skills will develop.
KARLINA: We have had much time already. But the mysteries of our world are still largely unknown.
DOCTOR: Well, there’s no rush. You’ve music, culture, craftsmanship. Above all, you too seem to have a healthy sense of curiosity. It’s a very good start.
KARLINA: Nothing will change here. Not for a long while.
DOCTOR: What makes you say that? (BEAT) Your daughter mentioned a stranger when we arrived. You said Isenfel does not have many visitors?
KARLINA: It is a very rare occurrence.
DOCTOR: But there was one recently? Before us?
KARLINA: A vessel appeared. A thing from the stars.
DOCTOR: Yes. We noticed some debris on the ice.
KARLINA: We saw its falling lights, several nights ago.
DOCTOR: And that’s how this stranger arrived?
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 32
KARLINA: A man was found in the wreckage. You must understand. We meet very few travellers from... outside. A handful over several generations. But now... you are so many.
DOCTOR: This man’s name, was it ‘Solus’?
KARLINA: Yes. I believe it was. Balancer Skarsgard was the one who tended him.
DOCTOR: He was unwell?
KARLINA: Alas, he was terribly injured when his carriage crashed into the ice.
DOCTOR: He was badly injured before the crash — er, quite possibly. Tell me, is this Solus still here? Somewhere in the palace?
KARLINA: Unfortunately, his wounds meant he could not survive.
DOCTOR: I see. (BEAT) Was he carrying anything? A glowing red crystal, perhaps?
KARLINA: You would have to ask the Balancer these questions. (STANDING) Our musicians are ready once again. (CALLING) Please. Play for our guests.
KARLINA: CLAPS. MUSICAL ENTERTAINMENT BEGINS AGAIN.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 33
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 18: INT. PALACE CORRIDOR, OUTSIDE HALL
DOCTOR WHO: FEASTING AND MUSIC IN HALL, OFF. SKARSGARD LEADING 4 x SERVANTS
DOCTOR WHO: (INC ROMY) TO STOP.
SKARSGARD: You four, wait here a moment. Prepare yourselves for your Queen.
JESPER: (RUNNING UP) Lord Balancer Skarsgard! Lord Balancer, sir!
ROMY: (WHISPER) Jesper! No!
JESPER: (CATCHING UP, PLEADING) Please, sir. I have only just heard! Madam Romy is my wife. I would go in her stead.
SKARSGARD: You know the rules, Jesper. This is her turn. We do not question the Balancing.
JESPER: Please.
SKARSGARD: Your mother and father did the same. As did Romy’s. As did their parents before them. It cannot be changed. Not for anyone.
JESPER: I am sorry. Lord Balancer. It does not seem fair.
SKARSGARD: There is no fair, or unfair. Only perpetual balance. Isenfel constant. (BEAT, FIRMER) Isenfel be constant.
JESPER: (MUTTERED) Isenfel be constant.
SKARSGARD: (TO SERVANTS) You four, your Queen awaits. Now, follow!
SKARSGARD: WALKS ON WITH SERVANTS, ENTERING HALL. CROSS TO:
SKARSGARD: be
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 34
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 19: INT. PALACE HALL, INGER’S TABLE (CONTINUOUS)
FEASTING: B/G, FLUTE MUSIC CONTINUES
INGER: You are enjoying our music, Sir Turlough?
TURLOUGH: It’s very... long.
INGER: Good. My mother is making arrangements for you to stay. — Ah, here they come now.
SKARSGARD: LEADS SERVANTS INTO HALL.
TURLOUGH: Who are those people?
INGER: Servants. This will not take much time. We can be on our way
INGER: soon.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 35
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 20: INT. PALACE HALL (CONTINUOUS)
SERVANTS: ACROSS CHAMBER.
DOCTOR: Ah, this must be the Balancer.
KARLINA: Indeed, Doctor. Now, excuse me while I perform my official duties.
SERVANTS: ASSEMBLE BEFORE THE QUEEN’S TABLE. HALL FALLS QUIET.
SKARSGARD: Here, my lady. We have four guests in Isenfel. So I bring four servants.
NYSSA: We’ve no need of servants, your majesty.
SKARSGARD: They are not for your use, young mistress. (CALLING) Behold, the Gauge of Equilibrium. (HOLDS UP BALANCING ROD)
SKARSGARD: GEIGER-COUNTER-LIKE RATTLING FROM THE ROD
PEOPLE: (MURMUR, LIKE A PRAYER RESPONSE) The Gauge of Equilibrium.
KARLINA: (STANDING) It is the time of the Balancing. Equilibrium must be maintained.
PEOPLE: (MURMUR) Equilibrium.
TEGAN: Doctor, what’s going on?
DOCTOR: I’m not entirely sure. (TO KARLINA) Queen Karlina-
KARLINA: (CUTTING HIM OFF) Silence, please. (TO ALL) These strangers are pleasing to us. We would have them remain in our company. And so the price must be paid. Isenfel be constant.
DOCTOR: (TO TEGAN AND NYSSA) Four of them, four of us. Oh no.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 36
NYSSA: What is it?
TEGAN: Yeah, what’s the problem?
DOCTOR: Four of them, four of us. Don’t you see?!
PEOPLE: (MUTTERED AROUND ROOM, UNDER PREVIOUS) Isenfel be constant.
KARLINA: On your knees. Romy. Helgar. Petra. Lars. You have served us well. We thank you.
SERVANTS: KNEEL.
SKARSGARD: Ready weapons!
GUARDS: DRAW SWORDS.
TEGAN: What are they doing? Doctor, what’s going on?
KARLINA: Fare thee well in the next life, good citizens of Isenfel. You die in the knowledge that you preserve the balance of our kingdom.
DOCTOR: (LEAPING UP) Your majesty, no! Please, not on our account!
KARLINA: Skarsgard. Execute them.
KARLINA: END OF PART ONE
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 37

elements.text: PART TWO
Fare thee well in the next life, good citizens of Isenfel. You die in the knowledge that you preserve the balance of our kingdom.
(LEAPING UP) Your majesty, no! Please, not on our account!
Skarsgard. Execute them.
SCENE 21: INT. PALACE HALL (CONTINUOUS)
LEAPS TABLE AND RUNS FORWARD. SWORDSMEN HESITATE.
Please! Whatever your traditions dictate, I can’t allow this to happen!
You stand in the way of our swordsmen? This is most unusual.
(CALLING) Doctor! What’s going on?
(CALLING) Stay there, Turlough. I’m sure this can all be sorted out amicably.
(APPROACHING) Your confusion is understandable. You do not know our tradition.
It’s tradition to slaughter the waiting staff when you invite someone over to dinner?
CLICKING FROM SKARSGARD’S GAUGE.
The Balancing... The Balancing is disturbed...
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 38
Believe me, if there’s some kind of population control in operation, we are more than happy to leave just as soon as we can.
(READING GAUGE) This is not right...
You do not wish to enjoy our hospitality? But we hope to learn so much from you, Doctor.
Then the first lesson is to stop these needless killings. Going ahead with this barbaric ‘tradition’ doesn’t encourage me to teach you anything.
My lady! The gauge. It is changing.
(CURIOUS) Let me take a look at that.
(SNATCHING GAUGE AWAY) No. It is forbidden. Only the Balancer may hold it.
All right. So what is your ‘Gauge of Equilibrium’ telling you?
The energies... they are shifting.
If you want my help, I suggest you enlighten me a little further.
Not here. We should not disturb the court any more than it is already.
CLAPS.
(CALLING) The feast is over. It seems Isenfel is undecided as to how to account for our guests. For a little while at least. All of you. Return to your dwellings.
(START TO MOVE OFF, CONFUSED MUTTERINGS EG:) The feast is over?/ Isenfel undecided?/ What’s all this about?
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 39
(CALLING) We thank our servants for their loyalty. Isenfel be constant.
(MUTTERED RESPONSES AS THEY LEAVE) Isenfel be constant.
(CLOSE) Doctor, what’s happening here?
(CLOSE) Whatever it is, it’s clearly ingrained. I suggest we tread carefully and do as they say. For now.
(CLOSE) Those servants were all so calm about it, happy to be led like lambs to the slaughter. How can any queen justify treating her people like that?
(CLOSE) I don’t know. But I’m going to find out.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 40
SCENE 22: EXT. TUNDRA
JESPER AND ROMY WALKING OVER ICE TOWARDS VILLAGE
Are you all right? Romy? You have not spoken since we left the hall.
I was ready, Jesper. I was ready for death. But all I could think of was them. The poor little mites. We no longer have Marta to help us. If anything happened to you, they’1l have no- one.
You are right. I have spoken with Caspar and Ella. I think they will join with us. Assist us.
Maybe these strangers will change things.
The other one didn’t. We cannot rely on outsiders. We need to do this ourselves.
COMMOTION OF VILLAGERS MOVING CARTS, ANIMALS, OFF. THEY STOP. STATIC-LIKE WHITE NOISE OF BLACK SNOW, DISTANT.
(CALLING) Get clear! Move away.
There’s a commotion in the village.
The black snow falls so close.
The Balancer should have taken me. I should have let it happen. Now we are paying the price.
BLEATING. OLD MAN TRYING TO HERD THEM
No. The black snow comes most nights now. It will require more than a few of Gerhard’s goats to pay for those strangers’ lives.
It should have been me. Only a human life can balance a human life.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 41
We’re supposed to be equal. But the privileged are protected. You know that. And you know why the black snow is really coming. We both do, Romy.
We must do something...
(CALLING) Gerhard! Get away! Leave them! (TO ROMY) The old fool. He should let the animals go.
I know I shouldn’t feel relieved. I shouldn’t fear the Balancing. But I do.
I know, woman. So do I. So do others. Now get yourself home. Stew some tea. I’11 stop our neighbour getting himself killed. (CALLING) Gerhard!
RUNS TO HELP.
(TO SELF) No. I don’t want to die. I’m not ready. Not yet.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 42
SCENE 23: INT. PALACE CHAMBER
DOOR SLIDES CLOSED. TEGAN AND NYSSA WALK INSIDE.
I knew there was something fishy going on. What kind of society treats its servants like that?
Those people were so calm. They didn’t question it.
You still think they should know their place?
I admit. It’s shocking to us. But it seems to be embedded. Everyone accepts this is the way things are.
That Balancer bloke. The Doctor thought he was like.. an accountant. But even the taxman doesn’t want you beheaded.
At least the Queen was willing to talk to the Doctor. Maybe there’s something he can do.
There should be something we can do too.
OPEN ICE DOOR.
Our escorts have disappeared. At least we’re not prisoners. —
THEM INTO CORRIDOR.
The Doctor told us to stay in our rooms.
What if they’re keeping people prisoner? What if there’s a whole jail full of willing human sacrifices? — Look, we’ve got to do something!
We can’t go trampling over their traditions. You’ve seen what happens. These people are used to killing.
SLIDES ICE DOOR SHUT.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 43
All right. We’1ll trample... carefully. Come on. I heard something down this way before...
THEY WALK DOWN CORRIDOR.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 44
SCENE 24: EXT. OUTSIDE PALACE STABLES
BEING LED OUT. INGER TACKING UP 2 x HORSES THROUGH:
You want me to what?!
Humour her. She’s obviously taken a liking to you.
(CALLING) Hurry, Sir Turlough. You promised me. The sooner we leave, the sooner your Doctor friend can attend my mother.
(INTERRUPTING) Thank you, your highness. I shan’t keep your riding companion a moment.
Doctor, this Princess is clearly psychotic.
At the moment the royal family of Isenfel is still inclined to be friendly towards us. There’s no reason to lose that advantage.
But those creatures are out there-
(INTERRUPTING) The Princess and her Huntsmen are used to dealing with them. By the time you all get back, I’m sure I’1l have everything sorted out and we’1ll be ready for the off.
Despite the TARDIS being under several metres of ice?
I haven’t forgotten. In fact, I suspect it’s the TARDIS that’s given us this opportunity.
What? How?
(MUSING) But when her self-diagnostics kick in, I’m not sure we'll have very much longer...
What are you talking about?
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 45
I suspect it’s all a question of energy conservation.
LEADS HORSE OVER
Here. Sir Turlough. Your steed.
Up you get, Turlough. It’s like riding a bike. Only with legs.
I never ride bikes. If I fall off and break my neck, I blame you. (EFFORTS AS MOUNTS HORSE)
(IGNORING HIM) That’s the spirit.
SLAPS HORSE’S FLANK. IT CANTERS OFF.
CRIES OUT AS HORSE RUNS AWAY WITH HIM
(ON HORSE) So eager, Sir Turlough. Wait for me! (CLICKS TONGUE;
TACK; HORSE CANTERS OFF)
(TO SELF) Now.. How to change a society’s entire belief system overnight? (ENTERING CASTLE) Why can’t I ever just go horse- riding...?
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 46
SCENE 25: INT. BALANCING CHAMBER
CLICKING, WHIRRING BALANCING CHAMBER B/G. DOOR SLIDES OPEN.
Enter, my lady, please.
We are curious, Balancer. Our kingdom makes an exception for this Doctor and his friends.
I have never seen such a thing before.
What do your signs and numbers say? What does the Gauge of Equilibrium tell you?
CLICKING OF GAUGE. TINKLING EFFECT CONTINUING THROUGH AS
READOUTS ARE ACTIVATED.
‘Recalibration’.. this word is new to me.
I have summoned this Doctor to the Balancing Chamber. Maybe he can aid our understanding.
You invite a stranger here? How can one not of Isenfel come to understand Isenfel?
Perhaps the picture is seen clearer from without, not within.
My lady-
My guardsmen will escort him once Inger has taken the boy on her hunt. He will be here soon.
I see you will not be turned from this course. You were always headstrong. Even as a girl.
I used to come and watch these lights and symbols dance across the ice back then.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 47
I should guard the secrets of the Balancing more carefully. (SHUTS OFF TINKLING HOLOGRAPHS) You should not have been in here unsupervised.
My father knew I came.
He was a good man. He knew his duty. I know the villagers suspect the rules do not apply to the high-born. But the Balancing is clear. Each family must make way for every new addition.
After Inger was born, Gustav and I would come here too. Just to get away from everyone.
I was aware of this transgression, at least, my lady. I thought you both deserved some private time. Prince Gustav was also a good man.
BEAT OF SILENCE.
I have been thinking long on my husband’s death. And the more I think... the more it appears to be without meaning. Our child did not survive six winters.
There is no knowing the ways of the Balancing.
Then perhaps it is time we learned.
That is why you hold this stranger to your bosom? It does not sit well with me.
Be careful, Skarsgard. Do not speak out of turn.
Only, I have observed... When you talk to him, there is a light in your eyes I have not seen for a long time. It is you who should take care, majesty.
This is an opportunity, Skarsgard. Something my father never had. A chance to gain greater knowledge.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 48
You assume that greater knowledge is for the best. Where Isenfel is concerned, that may not be true.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 49
SCENE 26: EXT. ICE PLAIN
6 x HORSES GALLOP ALONG.
(CALLING) The ride is thrilling, is it not, Sir Turlough?
(CALLING) That’s one word for it.
Halt. Here. (ALL PULL UP THEIR HORSES THROUGH:) There is a nest beyond that ridge. I spied a giant beast these last few nights.
Then maybe we shouldn’t get too close.
Torsten. Go ahead and find the trail.
(CALLING) At your command, Princess. Yah! (SPURS HORSE AND
ON)
We seek the pack leader, no less. Its head would be quite a prize to set above my mother’s hearth.
While you stew the rest of it up for dinner. Yes, I can quite believe- (BREAKS OFF)
CRACKLING OF BLACK SNOW IN DISTANCE.
What’s that? Back there, falling from the sky?
The black snow?
Yes, we saw it when we arrived. Is it some kind of weather phenomenon?
It is something we should stay away from. The black snow dissolves matter.
It does what?
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 50
It is Isenfel’s way of restoring the balance. If we do not do it ourselves, the black snow will come and do it for us. Isenfel be constant.
It’s moving over towards the village. It’s getting quite close to the houses.
It is the peasants’ own fault if they do not balance their affairs.
HUNSTMAN’S HORSE APPROACHES.
No-one’s very big on empathy here, are they?
(CALLING, OFF) Majesty. We have the tracks!
Come on. Follow me, Sir Turlough. We shall find this beast! Yah!
THEY RIDE ON.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 51
SCENE 27: INT. PALACE CORRIDOR
NYSSA AND TEGAN WALKING ON ICE-FLOOR THROUGH:
It was along here. Listen. Can you hear anything?
It feels like we’re going downhill. Perhaps we should just go back?
The cellars. Just the place you’d put a dungeon.
That noise could have been anything. An underground stream, the ice structures shifting. All these corridors... there’ll be echoes. Romy said this place could do strange things to sound.
Yeah. And don’t you think she looked more scared talking to us than when the queen was [about to-]
(CUTS HER OFF) Shh!
A CHILD'S CRY OFF, DISTANT.
There. That was definitely something.
(SETTING OFF) It came from this way. You were right, Tegan.
No. You were right. We should go back and tell the Doctor.
We’ve come this far.. We should check first. So we’ve got something to tell him.
Why are you so keen all of a sudden?
I can’t be absolutely certain... But that sounded like a child.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 52
SCENE 28: INT. PALACE CHAMBER
CLICKING, WHIRRING CLOCKWORK BALANCING CHAMBER B/G. KNOCK ON ICE DOOR. IT SLIDES OPEN.
(AT DOORWAY) Your majesty.
Welcome, Doctor. This is our Balancing Chamber.
Consider very carefully, my lady. Should we really allow a stranger to know our secrets?
AT DOORWAY) Please believe me. I am here only to help. (BEAT
Will you accept my help, Karlina?
I warn you that no good can- [come]
(INTERRUPTING) Balancer Skarsgard. I am ruler here. And I say we at least speak with the Doctor. What harm can it do?
But my lady-
Answer his questions. That is all I wish for now.
(ENTERING) Thank you, Karlina. (LOOKING AROUND) So tell me, what exactly are you balancing here?
Everything. All energies must be kept in harmony.
Including the people?
All arrivals require departures. Every birth must be balanced by death.
So when the royal family bears another heir, the commoners have to pay with their lives?
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 53
No! Every family takes responsibility for its own. Mine certainly has.
I see. So when you said not many reach old age in Isenfel, that’s why. They’re forced to make way for the next generation.
Not just people. Animals too. Our livestock must be carefully accounted for. The crops, such as they are. All energies that are harnessed and consumed. No excess is permitted.
It’s impossible to keep account of everything. What about the wildlife we encountered, for a start?
Princess Inger has charge of the culls. She has a quota.
If we do not do this, then Isenfel settles its own account.
How? (BEAT) Please. A little enlightenment won’t go amiss. Not if it saves lives.
That is the problem. We cannot afford to save every life.
People can’t be regulated like water from a tap.
That is exactly what must happen.
(DECIDING) Show him, Skarsgard. I command it.
I can only obey. — Here, Doctor. This is the Balancing.
ACTIVATES EQUILIBRIUM GAUGE. TINKLING HOLOGRAPHIC DISPLAY.
Yes, I wanted to ask you about this machinery of yours. Cogs and clockwork, interesting. What’s it all for?
Regard the display, Doctor.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 54
Numbers on a holographic readout. What’re they telling you, Skarsgard?
There should be nine thousand five hundred and eighty-two souls in Isenfel.
There always have been. And there always will be.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 55
SCENE 29: EXT. ICE RIDGE
6 x HORSES GALLOPING ALONG.
(CALLING) Halt here.
(CALLING) Hold, men!
STOP.
Dismount, Sir Turlough.
It’d be a pleasure.
INGER AND TURLOUGH DISMOUNT.
Torsten. Stay with the steeds. I will take our visitor closer to the lair.
Yes, majesty.

NYSSA: I can’t be absolutely certain... But that sounded like a child.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 52
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 28: INT. PALACE CHAMBER
DOCTOR WHO: CLICKING, WHIRRING CLOCKWORK BALANCING CHAMBER B/G. KNOCK ON ICE DOOR. IT SLIDES OPEN.
DOCTOR: (AT DOORWAY) Your majesty.
KARLINA: Welcome, Doctor. This is our Balancing Chamber.
SKARSGARD: Consider very carefully, my lady. Should we really allow a stranger to know our secrets?
DOCTOR: Will you accept my help, Karlina?
SKARSGARD: I warn you that no good can- [come]
KARLINA: (INTERRUPTING) Balancer Skarsgard. I am ruler here. And I say we at least speak with the Doctor. What harm can it do?
SKARSGARD: But my lady-
KARLINA: Answer his questions. That is all I wish for now.
DOCTOR: (ENTERING) Thank you, Karlina. (LOOKING AROUND) So tell me, what exactly are you balancing here?
SKARSGARD: Everything. All energies must be kept in harmony.
DOCTOR: Including the people?
KARLINA: All arrivals require departures. Every birth must be balanced by death.
DOCTOR: So when the royal family bears another heir, the commoners have to pay with their lives?
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 53
KARLINA: No! Every family takes responsibility for its own. Mine certainly has.
DOCTOR: I see. So when you said not many reach old age in Isenfel, that’s why. They’re forced to make way for the next generation.
SKARSGARD: Not just people. Animals too. Our livestock must be carefully accounted for. The crops, such as they are. All energies that are harnessed and consumed. No excess is permitted.
DOCTOR: It’s impossible to keep account of everything. What about the wildlife we encountered, for a start?
SKARSGARD: Princess Inger has charge of the culls. She has a quota.
KARLINA: If we do not do this, then Isenfel settles its own account.
DOCTOR: How? (BEAT) Please. A little enlightenment won’t go amiss. Not if it saves lives.
KARLINA: That is the problem. We cannot afford to save every life.
DOCTOR: People can’t be regulated like water from a tap.
SKARSGARD: That is exactly what must happen.
KARLINA: (DECIDING) Show him, Skarsgard. I command it.
SKARSGARD: I can only obey. — Here, Doctor. This is the Balancing.
SKARSGARD: ACTIVATES EQUILIBRIUM GAUGE. TINKLING HOLOGRAPHIC DISPLAY.
DOCTOR: Yes, I wanted to ask you about this machinery of yours. Cogs and clockwork, interesting. What’s it all for?
SKARSGARD: Regard the display, Doctor.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 54
DOCTOR: Numbers on a holographic readout. What’re they telling you, Skarsgard?
SKARSGARD: There should be nine thousand five hundred and eighty-two souls in Isenfel.
KARLINA: There always have been. And there always will be.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 55
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 29: EXT. ICE RIDGE
DOCTOR WHO: 6 x HORSES GALLOPING ALONG.
INGER: (CALLING) Halt here.
HUNSTMAN: (CALLING) Hold, men!
HORSES: STOP.
INGER: Dismount, Sir Turlough.
TURLOUGH: It’d be a pleasure.
TURLOUGH: INGER AND TURLOUGH DISMOUNT.
INGER: Torsten. Stay with the steeds. I will take our visitor closer to the lair.
HUNSTMAN: Yes, majesty.
TURLOUGH: Is that wise? I’d be quite happy to see the wildlife from a distance.
CRUNCHING: OVER ICE. INGER CROUCHES BY RIDGE AND LOOKS OVER.
SNORING: SNOWBEAST FAINT BELOW.
INGER: (HUSHED) Here, Sir Turlough. — You see the cleft in the ice? That is where it makes its den.
CROUCHING: BESIDE HER.
TURLOUGH: Not the most comfortable of beds.
INGER: We are close now. I can smell the beast.
TURLOUGH: (SHIFTS CLOSER) And I can see it. Sleeping. It’s huge...
INGER: Let me string an arrow...
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 56
STRINGING: ARROW INTO BOW.
TURLOUGH: You can’t expect to kill a beast that size with a single arrow!
INGER: I do not mean to kill the beast yet, Sir Turlough. Only to wake it. I want to hunt.
TURLOUGH: What?
INGER: When I loose this shaft, run for your steed. The beast will be quick. So we must be quicker.
TURLOUGH: (EDGING BACK) You really are utterly mad. Well, if you’re not going to let sleeping dogs lie, I’m getting a head start.
SETS: OFF BACK TO HORSE.
INGER: You want to race, Sir Turlough? That suits me well.
FIRES: ARROW. SNOWBEAST ROARS IN ANGER. INGER RUNS FOR HER HORSE.
INGER: Now the chase is on!
SNOWBEAST: SCRAMBLES SNARLING OUT OF ICE AND ONTO PLAIN, GIVES A
HUGE: ROAR.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 57
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 30: INT. BALANCING CHAMBER
CLICKING: BALANCING CHAMBER, WITH TINKLING HOLOGRAMS ACTIVATED.
DOCTOR: Can’t you see how monstrous this is? How long have you been dishing out death sentences on the whim of these... fairy lights?
SKARSGARD: It has ever been so. And it shall ever be so. Isenfel be constant!
KARLINA: Isenfel be constant.
DOCTOR: Isenfel be blowed! I refuse to believe any society can be this blinkered, this stifled, all of its own accord. E-Space or not, this isn’t how life works.
SKARSGARD: This is our way of life. It is no mere belief.
DOCTOR: No, it’s not. Despite the clockwork dressing, the technology behind that display is far beyond the capabilities of a society like yours. (BEAT) Still, now we know what happened to Solus, I suppose.
KARLINA: I told you. Your fellow stranger’s injuries meant that he could not survive.
DOCTOR: But he didn’t die from those injuries, did he?
SKARSGARD: His presence could not be sustained.
KARLINA: It made no sense to sacrifice one of my healthy subjects for this man.
DOCTOR: So you put him to death.
KARLINA: Yes. (BEAT) Was that wrong?
DOCTOR: And there we have the nub of the problem.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 58
DOCTOR: STARTS PULLING COMPONENTS FROM WALLS. COGS AND WHEELS CLATTER.
SKARSGARD: Do not touch the sacred machines of the Balancing!
DOCTOR: (PULLING THINGS FROM WALL) Sacred machines, Skarsgard? That doesn’t ring true I’m afraid.
MORE: COGS AND WHEELS CLATTER.
KARLINA: Doctor! We did not ask for this!
SKARSGARD: (DISTRAUGHT) See, my lady. It was folly to show him! This Doctor would destroy everything!
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 59
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 31: EXT. ICE PLAIN
HORSES: GALLOP IN PURSUIT OF SNARLING, SNAPPING SNOWBEAST
INGER: (RIDING) There it goes! Keep hard on its trail.
TURLOUGH: (RIDING) It can’t run forever, can it?
INGER: (RIDING) You do well to keep up with my riders, Sir Turlough. You enjoy yourself after all!
TURLOUGH: (RIDING) I just don’t want to get left behind out here with more of those things!
INGER: (CALLING) There. It heads between the ice-dunes. Take care now. We are nearing the Edge.
ALL: RIDERS SLOW.
TURLOUGH: The Edge? Of what?
SNARLING: RUNNING BEAST SUDDENLY YELPS, OFF.
INGER: It is injured! Chase it down!
SNOWBEAST: HOWLS WITH PAIN, OFF. CRACKLING DISTORTED ROARS DROWN IT OUT.
TURLOUGH: What was that?
INGER: I do not know. (CALLING) Advance with care...
SEVERAL: CREATURES GROWL AND SNARL, SIMILAR TO SNOWBEAST BUT WITH ENHANCED FX MAKING THE NOISES DISTORTED AND CRACKLE. THEY APPROACH FROM AROUND THE DUNE.
TURLOUGH: I think we know what finished it off...
INGER: What are these creatures?
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 60
TURLOUGH: Black snowbeasts. You don’t think...
INGER: What?
TURLOUGH: That they might perhaps serve the same function as the black snow?
INGER: I have never seen these monsters before. (STRINGING BOW) But I shall have a new hide to wear... Fire!
INGER: INGER AND HUNTERS FIRE ARROW AT THEM. BLACK SNOWBEASTS ROAR AND
ARROWS: SHIMMER AND DISSOLVE.
TURLOUGH: They just dissolved your arrows. And they haven’t stopped.
HUNTSMAN: I shall put them to the sword, Princess!
TURLOUGH: No, wait! — Don’t you see? You can’t kill them, you [idiot!]
BLACK: SNOWBEASTS ATTACK. HUNTSMAN SCREAMS AND DISSOLVES FIZZING.
TURLOUGH: Told you.
INGER: Back! Come, Sir Turlough. Away from the pack!
TURLOUGH: Too late! They’re coming!
BLACK: BEASTS SNARL AND HOWL AND ATTACK THE HUNTSMEN.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 61
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 32: INT. BALANCING CHAMBER
DOCTOR: FINISHES PULLING FINAL COGS AND WHEELS FROM WALL —
WHIRRING: B/G HAS STOPPED. TINKLING HOLOGRAPHIC DISPLAY
CONTINUES: B/G
SKARSGARD: You have desecrated the Balancing Chamber. You have destroyed my machines.
DOCTOR: I’ve done nothing of the sort. Look. Your holographic interface is functioning perfectly.
KARLINA: It is true, Skarsgard. The lights still dance. The Balancing continues.
DOCTOR: (TAPPING ICE, FEELING ALONG WALL) The readouts are being projected into the ice. They’re generated from something behind these walls.
KARLINA: We are beneath the centre of our palace. There are no other chambers to find.
DOCTOR: All those cogs and wheels were decorations, built up over years. Trinkets, like the Balancer’s accoutrements of office.
SKARSGARD: The symbols of my power!
DOCTOR: We know about your Gauge of Equilibrium, of course — but what’s that thing hanging from your belt? (BEAT) It looks very much like a light -key.
SKARSGARD: The Lens of Harmony? It is not a key to anything.
DOCTOR: Of course, you’ve no reason to think it’s a key, if you don’t even know there’s a door.
KARLINA: There is only one door into this room. Doctor, you were supposed to provide understanding but you bring only confusion!
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 62
DOCTOR: All right. Answer me one more question and then I’1l stop. How many Balancers have there been?
KARLINA: I do not understand. There has always been a Balancer.
SKARSGARD: And I am fortunate enough to hold that position.
DOCTOR: Yes, I thought it was an office, a title. But no, it’s only ever been you, hasn’t it?
SKARSGARD: I... am.. the Balancer. It is the way it has always been.
KARLINA: Skarsgard served my father and his father before him.
DOCTOR: Really? Is that really true? And you don’t think there’s anything unusual about that?
KARLINA: It’s the way-
DOCTOR: -it has always been. Yes. So tell, me Karlina. What kind of man lives hundreds, maybe thousands of years while all around him grow old and die? Hm?
KARLINA: (CONFUSED) It is... Skarsgard.. He is the Balancer.
DOCTOR: Possibly no kind of man at all.
SKARSGARD: Do not insult me. I am loyal. I am true. I serve Isenfel.
DOCTOR: That’s as maybe. But let’s see what happens when we go through the looking glass.
DOCTOR: SNATCHES KEY FROM SKARSGARD’S BELT.
SKARSGARD: What? — No! Give me back the Lens of Harmony!
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 63
DOCTOR: If this is a key — this slot must be the lock, I think. (HE
CLICKS: KEY INTO PLACE IN ICE WALL)
ICE: STARTS SLIDING, WALLS MOVING, SMOOTH ELECTRONIC HUM BEHIND.
DOCTOR: There, what did I tell you?
KARLINA: Skarsgard, what is happening?
SKARSGARD: (ELECTRONIC DISTORT, ROBOTIC) Maintenance access granted. Maintenance access granted.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 64
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 33: INT. LOWER ROOM
SEVERAL: CHILDREN OF TODDLER AGE AND BELOW QUIETLY PLAYING THROUGH.
ROMY: That’s it, my loves. You stay quiet. Uncle Jesper will be along soon with milk and biscuits.
ROMY: TAPPING ON ICE DOOR.
ROMY: That’1l be him now.
DOOR: SLIDES OPEN.
NYSSA: Romy !
ROMY: Oh no... You!
ROMY: TEGAN AND NYSSA ENTER.
TEGAN: So this is what you were hiding!
NYSSA: Don’t be alarmed, Romy. We only want to help you.
TEGAN: Nyssa... You were right. Little kids! It’s like a créche.
DOOR: CLOSES BEHIND THEM.
ROMY: Oh my mistresses. Please... You should not have come!
NYSSA: I’m guessing the queen knows nothing of this?
ROMY: Do not betray us.. I beg you.
TEGAN: Why are you holding all these children prisoner?
ROMY: No! We are protecting them. Here is the safest place in the kingdom for them.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 65
TEGAN: Right underneath the queen and her guards?
ROMY: We have always believed the palace shields the royals from the gaze of the Balancing.
TEGAN: What do you mean? Shields them?
NYSSA: I think I understand... You think keeping them here means their families outside don’t have to.. pay.
DOOR: OPENS. JESPER ENTERS.
ROMY: We are saving the lives of their kin.
TEGAN: By keeping these kids locked up?
JESPER: My wife is right. We are saving everybody’s lives.
DOOR: CLOSES
NYSSA: Jesper. We need to find our friend. The Doctor will know what
NYSSA: to do.
JESPER: No. (DRAWS SWORD) You both stay where you are.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 66
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 34: INT. INNER BALANCING CHAMBER
DOCTOR WHO: HUM OF HOLOGRAPHIC CONTROL SYSTEMS. OCCASIONAL CHATTER OF CALCULATION.
DOCTOR: So this is the secret inside your palace.
SKARSGARD: (ROBOTIC FX) Isenfel be constant... Isenfel be constant.
KARLINA: What has happened to Skarsgard? He is bewitched?
DOCTOR: He’s a part of the system.
KARLINA: These machines... I have never seen the like...
DOCTOR: You say Isenfel has no science, Karlina? I think you’ve rather more of it than you realise...
KARLINA: What is Skarsgard?
DOCTOR: Good question. I think he’s been left to watch over things. A kind of.. monitor. (TO SELF) How long has this been running?
DOCTOR: TRIES SOME CONTROLS, TINKLY ACTIVATION SOUNDS.
KARLINA: Should you be touching those devices?
DOCTOR: How else can I find out what’s going on?
KARLINA: You understand them?
DOCTOR: (USING CONTROLS) I’m a quick learner. Borusa always said my understanding of logical systems far surpassed my ability to explain them. (USING CONTROLS) Ah, as I thought.
KARLINA: The Balancing... It is controlled by these screens and lights?
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 67
DOCTOR: Skarsgard here’s been taking his duties rather too literally. The system is set to maintain constant energy levels, but it allows for the ebb and flow of life. There are stress factors built into the parameters, see?
KARLINA: Your words... wash over me...
DOCTOR: Look, Karlina. You recognise this? (ACTIVATES MAP)
DOCTOR: HUM OF MAP DISPLAY.
KARLINA: It is a map.. of my kingdom.
DOCTOR: Sealed inside an energy dome. The transduction barrier the
TARDIS: crossed... (TO KARLINA) And what do you think these pulses represent?
BEEPING: PULSES.
KARLINA: Lives. Individuals. My people.
DOCTOR: The system’s at its limit. There’s an energy threshold it’s meant to maintain. It’s adapted. In fact... it’s taken it upon itself to create its own means of matter dispersal.
KARLINA: The black snow?
DOCTOR: That’s right. And maybe something more.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 68
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 35: EXT. EDGE OF ICE PLAIN
DOCTOR WHO: INGER AND TURLOUGH’S HORSES RACING TOWARDS THE EDGE - AN ENERGY WATERFALL AT THE END OF THE WORLD.
INGER: Pull up, Sir Turlough!
INGER: THEY STOP. INGER DISMOUNTS.
INGER: We continue on foot. The horses can carry us no more.
TURLOUGH: (DISMOUNTING) What about your Huntsmen? Are they...?
INGER: They gave their lives so we could escape the black beasts... But I fear there is no escape. See where they have driven us.
INGER: THEY WALK CLOSER TO THE ENERGY WATERFALL.
TURLOUGH: What is that?
INGER: It is the edge of our world!
TURLOUGH: The edge..? You mean the planet just ends right there?
INGER: Your world does not?
TURLOUGH: No. Nor does any other I’ve been to. What’s over the edge?
BLACK: SNOWBEASTS DISTORTED SNARLING IN DISTANCE APPROACHING.
INGER: No-one knows. But I fear we may be the first to find out...
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 69
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 36: INT. LOWER ROOM
JESPER: (ADVANCES WITH SWORD) You shouldn’t have come here, young mistresses.
TEGAN: Now hold on a minute. Put the sword away!
NYSSA: Please, we didn’t mean any harm!
JESPER: When I balance your lives against that of my wife, against the lives of these children... I know which way the scales fall.
ROMY: Jesper, no!
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 70
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 37: EXT. ICE PLAIN
HORSES: WHINNY. DISTORTED SNARLING AS BLACK SNOWBEASTS APPROACH.
TURLOUGH: What now, Inger? There’s nowhere left to run.
INGER: The steeds are exhausted. Death will be a release for them.
TURLOUGH: I was thinking more about us.
INGER: I am glad to have met you. You have been most diverting company, Sir Turlough.
HORSE: WHINNYING, DEVOURED BY BLACK SNOWBEAST DISTORTION.
INGER: (CALLING) Come, creatures of darkness! I am a royal daughter of Isenfel and my spirit will poison you! (CLOSE) When they take me, you must escape.
TURLOUGH: I’m not leaving you. You really are terribly brave. (SOTTO) Or stupid. I’m not sure which.
SNARLING: BLACK SNOWBEASTS CLOSE IN.
INGER: It is a good day to meet death, is it not?
TURLOUGH: I've had better...
INGER: Come here, Sir Turlough. (GRABS TURLOUGH AND KISSES HIM)
TURLOUGH: (RELEASED) What was- [that for?]
INGER: (OVER HIM) Thank you. Now run!
TURLOUGH: Where to? We’re trapped between the monsters and the edge of the world!
DISTORTED: ROARS OF BLACK SNOWBEASTS.
DISTORTED: END OF PART TWO
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL)

elements.text: PART THREE
REPRISE FROM SCENE 36:
Please, we didn’t mean any harm!
Page 71
When I balance your lives against that of my wife, against the
lives of these children... I know which way the scales fall.
Jesper, no!
SCENE 38: INT. LOWER CHAMBER [CONTINUOUS]
(WIELDING SWORD) Be quiet, woman. Take the children to the
other room. I have no choice!
You can’t be serious...!
OPENS. DOCTOR RUNS INTO ROOM BETWEEN THEM. CHILDREN CRY
B/G.
Stop this. Now!
Doctor!
Talk about cutting it fine!
Stay out of my way, stranger.
If you won’t listen to me, listen to
ENTERS.
What is the meaning of this? Jesper?
Your majesty... I... I-
your queen.
Romy?
IN
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 72
Sheathe your weapon, huntsman.
I obey, your highness. (SHEATHES SWORD)
How did you find us Doctor?
You appeared on a map. Along with all these unaccounted lives.
STARTS CRYING.
What is this place? A nursery, beneath my feet? How many?
(SETTLING CHILDREN) Sh. Three babes in arms. And four others, all less than three turns old.
You use the royal palace for your own ends. This litter of children. Who are they? Where did they come from?

The villagers were so afraid, majesty... Kendra has no family... if she gives her life, who looks after her little one? Vorn and Kalla, they are barely twenty, now one of them must die for their child... Helga-
Enough! All in Isenfel know the price we must pay.
You mean kill off grandpa so the kids can live?
Didn’t your uncle cull rabbits to protect his farm? A similar principle. Taken to a ruthless extreme.
(ANGRY) It’s a little bit different from that!
But you see the Doctor’s point? That’s why they were so ready to kill to make space for us...
It is not you who disturb the equilibrium of Isenfel. It is my own people.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 73

I’m hoping your ‘equilibrium’ can be adjusted. I set the control system to re-calibrate and re-align its parameters according to the current energy levels. At least I think I did... (BEAT) Anyway, all matter dispersal should stop, for now.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 74
REPRISE FROM SCENE 37:
We’re trapped... between the monsters and the edge of the world!
ROARS OF BLACK SNOWBEASTS.
SCENE 39: EXT. ICE PLAIN [CONTINUOUS]
They are upon us!
(CROUCHING) Do you think it’1ll hurt?
SNOWBEASTS ROAR CLOSER THEN PASS THEM AND LEAP INTO
WATERFALL.
(SURPRISED) No... No, I do not think it will!
(GETTING UP) What are they doing?
They’re ignoring us... running over the edge of the ice.
SHIMMERING, SCRAPING, SHIFTING AS THE BARRIER CHANGES.
And being absorbed back into the energy field...
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 75
SCENE 40: INT. LOWER CHAMBER
FUSS IN B/G.
Doctor. We have been granted some time, have we not? By this... recalibration of yours?
I do hope so, your majesty.
Good. — Romy, take these children to our kitchens. Feed them. When they are fed, they will be returned to their families.
We’ll help you. Come on, Tegan.
Me-? (SIGH) All right. Come along, you little tykes.
NYSSA AND TEGAN HELP ROMY GATHER CHILDREN.
Good job, Tegan. But Nyssa, I’1ll need your help very soon.
Romy, afterwards you will arrange an escort for Lady Nyssa to the Balancing Chamber.
Yes, highness. Thank you highness.
TEGAN, NYSSA AND ROMY TAKE CHILDREN OUT.
The lady Nyssa will join us once the children are settled.
Good. Nyssa has rather a knack with logical systems. (BEAT) Now, we should get back to Skarsgard.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 76
SCENE 41: EXT. ICE PLAIN
SHIMMERING, SCRAPING, SHIFTING AS THE BARRIER CHANGES CNTINUES.
What’s happening, Sir Turlough? Now the sky is changing colour!
We’re not getting any answers here. We should go back to your palace.
THEY HURRY ACROSS THE ICE, AWAY FROM ENERGY WATERFALL.
(RUNNING) Yes... go back, and tell my mother what we have seen.
(RUNNING) And the Doctor. I don’t know about you, but I’ve had quite enough of the end of the world.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 77
SCENE 42: INT. PALACE KITCHENS
PLATES AND CUPS, BABIES FEEDING AND CHILDREN EATING THROUGH.
(FEEDING BABY WITH BOTTLE) They have not been fed so well in quite some time. We took what we could, but it was never enough.
Do you need a hand with that bottle, Tegan?
(STRUGGLING TO FEED BABY WITH BOTTLE) It’d be easier if the little beggar stopped wriggling.
Here. Let me show you-
I can do it! It’s easy for you, you’ve had the practice. (BREAKS OFF, BEAT) Sorry, Nyssa. Opened my mouth without thinking...
Ct Ss all right.
I’m a rubbish friend and a rubbish babysitter.
No, Tegan. Look. He’s settled now. (BEAT) It would have been wonderful to have you around.
These kids... They should be with their families.
But we know what their families would have had to do. Make a sacrifice for any new arrival.
It is how it has always been.
I can’t believe it. If you know that’s what happens... why would anyone ever have children?
Some things can’t be controlled. And once you become a parent, there’s nothing you wouldn’t do to keep them safe.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 78
But still, it is so very hard. Especially if you’ve no-one to depend on. To balance with. That is the case for these poor mites.
But you think here in the palace they’re protected? Shielded somehow?
The royal house has always had special privilege, beyond wealth and rank. We do not believe the Balancing casts quite so harsh an eye on this palace.
You mean the royals don’t pay the same price as everyone else? That figures.
They do follow the rules of succession. Queen Karlina has her own sadness to bear. I cannot deny that. But the black snow never falls anywhere near here.
Black snow?
It is how Isenfel takes its payment if we do not balance our own accounts. The black snow falls and destroys all it touches.
This place gets madder by the second.
ENTERS.
Madam Romy. We were summoned.
Lady Nyssa. Your escort.
(GOING TO DOOR) I need to go to the Doctor. He said he wanted my help. And we still need to work out how to get away from here...
Go on. I’1l give Romy a hand getting this lot back down to the village.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 79
Be careful, Tegan.
You too. I’ll be back as soon as I can.
(DEPARTING) And you could ask about getting the TARDIS out the ice!
EXITS ALONG CORRIDOR.
Of course! I’d almost forgotten.
You think he will save us, this Doctor of yours?
That’s what he does. Really, he just can’t help himself.
of
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 80
SCENE 43: INT. BALANCING CHAMBER
MACHINERY B/G IN INNER CHAMBER AS DOCTOR AND KARLINA
SKARSGARD OUT.
(ROBOTIC FX) Isenfel be constant... Isenfel be constant.
(LEADING SKARSGARD FROM INNER CHAMBER) That’s it, Karlina. Help me guide him out.
(HELPING DOCTOR) Skarsgard will recover himself... outside the inner sanctum?
That’s what I’m assuming. If we remove him from the core environment, his programming should revert...
(GASPING — SUDDENLY HIMSELF AGAIN) My Queen... My Queen... I am sorry... SO very sorry. You... your family have been deceived all this time. I am not what you thought me to be...
You have nothing to apologise for, Balancer Skarsgard. You are still the same man.
But I am not a man. I am no subject of yours my lady.
You are. You are my family’s oldest and truest friend.
You realise what you’ve been doing? Culling your subjects. Under orders from the people who put these controls in place. But from what I can tell, they’re long gone.
I have ordered the deaths of... so many... over generations. It has all been my doing.
I suppose, in a way, you’ve kept this place going. If life had run riot, everything inside the atmosphere bubble would have just been wiped out.
We obey because that is how our lives have always been here. Listen, Skarsgard. There’s nothing else we could have done.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 81
That’s the trouble when you’re trapped inside a system. You can’t see any other way...

Doctor. You wanted my help?

SCENE 44: INT. INNER BALANCING CHAMBER (CONTINUOUS)
CONTROLS HUM B/G. NYSSA AND DOCTOR ENTER.
(LEADING NYSSA TO CONTROLS) I need you to... check my working, as it were.
Me, Doctor? What can I do?
(USING CONTROLS) Here. It’s all quite logical. Isenfel is an experimental environment. Artificial atmosphere, simulated night and day, locked inside a sealed force-field.
I see. This is the map you were talking about.
MAP ACTIVATES

(USING CONTROLS) I see. You’ve started a recalibration.

And what about the TARDIS?
Ah. (DEMONSTRATING CONTROLS) This is an energy monitor. Now, what do you think is the biggest source of untapped energy in this kingdom?
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 83
Of course!
Only the system doesn’t recognise it. I thought you might try adjusting the scanners. Carefully.
And what will you be doing in the meantime?
Talking to Skarsgard. He’s had a shock.
What about Solus, and the interface stabiliser?
(GOES TO DOORWAY) I’ve not forgotten. — So. You’re happy with what you’ve got to do?
Not ‘happy’ exactly... But I’ll try.
I know that feeling well. (BEAT) Am I making things better? I don’t know, Nyssa. I just don’t know.

Let’s hope so. (EXITING)
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 84
SCENE 45: EXT. ICE PATH — ON CART
TEGAN AND ROMY IN HORSE-DRAWN CART. JESPER DRIVING IT ALONG ICE
THROUGHOUT. CHILD COUGHS AND CRIES.
Uh-oh. I’ve got one being sick back here!
(CALLING FROM DRIVER'S SEAT) We fed them too well, I think!
Here. (HANDING TEGAN CLOTHS) It is not much further. We ride through the pass and the village is beyond.
(MOPPING UP) I don’t suppose you’ve a change of clothes at your place? For me I mean.
Nothing like these strange garments you wear now!

But still, they must trust you both.

SCENE 46: INT. BALANCING CHAMBER
B/G IN INNER CHAMBER AS DOCTOR EMERGES

I will have my people assist. We have tools we can use to cut the ice.

Skarsgard.

WATERFALL OF DISTORTION, DISTANT. TURLOUGH AND INGER WALKING
ICE THROUGH.
So that’s how things are run here. It’s rather like a great big petri dish.
All in Isenfel must be willing to make the sacrifice.

You think so? I never knew my grandfather. He had to die so I could live. That was his gift to me, and I will not waste it.

(STOPPING) I know... But I have never seen a dawn like this one.

WATERFALL OF DISTORTION INCREASES IN PITCH, COMES SLOWLY CLOSER.
Get up, Sir Turlough. We cannot rest.
Please. Just a few minutes-

The edge of our kingdom is coming closer.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 89

(SETTING OFF) You’ve convinced me. Come on, we need to move.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 90
SCENE 48: EXT. VILLAGE
TEGAN, ROMY AND JESPER WALKING OVER SNOW. A CHILD HAPPILY RUNS TO ITS PARENTS.

The Doctor will think of something. I’m sure he will.

You don’t have any kids yourselves?

Or cursed. Since if we had, then one of us...
Yeah. Right. I don’t know how you can live like this.
It is all we know.
There is no other way. We live with the certainty of death.
But doesn’t that make you want to fight back?

We tried. But now we know there is no other way. The Balancing is as constant as the ice beneath our feet. (RESIGNED) Isenfel be constant.

(RESIGNED) Isenfel be constant. Follow, Lady Tegan. I shall return you to the palace.
Thanks. Goodbye Romy. I hope we can- (INTERRUPTED)
CRIES OF VILLAGERS, OFF. DISTORTED STATIC OF BLACK SNOW IN DISTANCE.
What is it?
Black snow.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 92
SCENE 49: EXT. ICE GARDEN
WALKING OVER ICE, SCRAPING AND CUTTING INTO ICE.
Thank you for your assistance, your majesty.
The Doctor and Skarsgard have things to discuss. They are best left alone.
I agree. I wasn’t entirely sure what those systems were telling me, but there was definitely something here.
Just outside my palace walls. In our ice gardens.
The sculptures are incredible in their detail.
We were so very proud of our craftsmen. But now, all this art means so... little.
On the contrary, your highness. I can tell everything in Isenfel has meaning to you. The palace itself is a magnificent structure. Elegant in its simplicity. And so very beautiful.
You have a regal bearing, Lady Nyssa. Unlike your friends. Am I right in thinking you are from noble stock?

You are wise beyond your years. You and the Doctor, you have the eyes of older souls.

I’m a lot older than I look. The Doctor too. (ASIDE) I’m starting to realise how he sometimes feels. (TO KARLINA) I’ve been travelling for a long time... But I’m ready to stop. That’s where we differ.
You believe in him. As I believed in Skarsgard...
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 93
I do. The Doctor is a good man. He will always try and make a difference.
OFF.

My hunters have found something.

My palace has always been at the centre of things. People and things are drawn to it.
Maybe that’s it. While the TARDIS was losing energy, Isenfel’s control systems pulled it in towards the palace so they could work out what it was.
If this machine can do all you claim, then it may prove useful.
Oh yes. The TARDIS can be very useful indeed.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 94
SCENE 50: INT. INNER BALANCING CHAMBER
HOLOGRAPHIC SYSTEMS HUM B/G
(ENTERING) Follow me. Please. It shouldn’t be such a shock this time.
(OUTSIDE) I.. I will not lose myself?

Artificial?
You’re an incredibly complex machine.
I am not... alive?
Not strictly speaking, no. But then again. What’s life, if not an incredibly complex machine?
Then... I shall enter. (ROBOTIC FX AS HE ENTERS ROOM) Isenfel be constant.
You’re doing well, Skarsgard. I think the system reset has run its course.
(FX) System recalibrated. Diagnostics running. (BEAT) lI... see... all of Isenfel, through my mind.
(USING CONTROLS) That’s right. Now, I want to dig a little deeper into the core programming. (BEAT) I’m afraid this may hurt.
(FX) If I am a machine, how do I feel pain?
