EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 95
(FX) I have... excess energy? How does this not disturb the balance?
You’re the monitor. You’re outside the parameters of the system. I need to give your workings a jolt to see them clearly.
(FX) This ‘jolt’ will... cause pain?
I’m afraid so, yes. I have to access the shell program. There’s something behind it. A message.
(FX) Do it, Doctor. Discover the truth.
All right. And I’m really very sorry... (ACTIVATES CONTROLS )
(FX) CRIES OUT IN PAIN
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 96

PANICKING. CRYING IN FEAR. RUNNING OVER ICE. STATIC DISTORT OF BLACK SNOW BLIZZARD.
(B/G PANIC) Help! Save us! We are lost!
I’ve never seen the black snow fall so thick.
It’s like it’s deliberately attacking the village.
It has come for us. We have brought this on ourselves...
Can’t we get inside? Under cover!
There’s nowhere to go. It’s all around. The huts will dissolve like everything else!
Everything...? (REMEMBERING) But not the palace! We need to get everyone back up to the palace.
The children. This is happening because we brought the children outside...
No, this storm is bigger than any I’ve seen before. Those few small lives cannot be the cause.
I thought the Doctor reset everything. That it would all get... balanced out.
Even your Doctor cannot fight the constancy of Isenfel.
Load the carts. Lady Tegan is right. (CALLING) Everyone. Run, ride, flee! Go back through the mountain pass. Do not stop. We must rely on the mercy of our queen.
START TO RUSH TO DEPART.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 97
Our village... Our lives. They are being laid waste. (BEAT) We have caused this. It is all my fault.
Romy! No!
(WALKING AWAY) Even one life can make a difference!
What are you doing? Don’t walk towards it!
Romy, Please! Don’t leave me...
(CALLING) I love you Jesper. But you live for both of us now... Aaargh! (SCREAMS AS SHE DISSOLVES IN STATIC DISTORT)

GRABS HIM.

me a horse.
A horse?
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 98

DISTORTION IN THE SKY, A DISTANT WATERFALL OF
CLOSES IN.
(STOPPING) Stop... a moment...
(STOPPING) Let’s catch our breath.

Here in Isenfel, we accept the inevitable.
Well, I’m not from Isenfel, and death is something I plan to put off for as long as possible. Come on!

EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 99

TINKLING AND HUMMING CONTROLS SYSTEMS ACTIVATING.

how do I get this to play...?
(ROBOTIC FX) Activate.
ACTIVATES.

(ECHOEY RECORDING PLAYBACK ON-SCREEN, DISTORTED, BROKEN, SKIPPING) Isenfel Experimental environment - (HISS) - closed system simulation — (HISS) - to allow energy venting within parameters — (HISS) - create internal entropy fields — (SKIPPING) — in case of emergency, the life-forms can adapt to remove excess — (HISS)
A recording. Of course. Any good scientist makes notes. But this is very old... it’s been corrupted.
(D) — the record of Experimenter Viktor Skarsgard.
See, Balancer? You’re modelled on the original experimenter. You did have the voice of God after all.

(D, PLAYBACK STABILISES) We have created this system and seeded it with life to investigate our theory. Our universe is collapsing. And the rate of decay is much quicker than anticipated. By simulating this collapse we can discover more about the eventual fate of our universe.
Now we’re getting somewhere.
FAST-FORWARDING OF RECORDING.

(D) Record nine zero three. The experiment is over. We have turned our attention instead to means of escape. We believe there may be a passage to external universes.. Isenfel has been a glorious failure.
EXTENDED ‘END-OF-MESSAGE’ BEEP.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 100
(FX) System wipe.
What? (AT CONTROLS, DISMAYED) No. Why are you doing that?
(FX) Entropy protocols engaged. All energy venting. Isenfel experimental environment, shutting down.

EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 101
SCENE 54: EXT. VILLAGE ROAD
SNOW DISTORT B/G. VILLAGERS MOVING OUT ALONG ICE-PATH WITH CARTS, HORSES.
(LEADING HORSE) Right. Give me a leg up, Jesper.
Lars says this stallion is good-tempered. It should serve you well. (HELPING TEGAN MOUNT) You are sure, Lady Tegan?
(SETTLING HERSELF ON SADDLE) I’m sure all right. Romy bought us some time. You need to get your people away, and I need to find my friend. He’s lost out there somewhere.

GALLOPS OFF.

RUNS TOWARDS OTHERS.

EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 102

INGER AND TURLOUGH RUNNING. A WATERFALL OF DISTORTION FOLLOWS

SCENE 56: INT. INNER BALANCING CHAMBER
SYSTEMS AND ALARMS TINKLING AND HUMMING, BUILDING THROUGH IN B/G.
(SHAKING SKARSGARD) Come on... Skarsgard! Speak to me!
DASHES TO CONTROL BANKS. NYSSA RUNS IN.
(CALLING) Doctor! We’ve found the TARDIS! It got dragged in towards central control. They’re digging for it in the palace garden!

(RUNNING TO ANOTHER CONTROL BANK) So did I. But it seems all I managed to do was stave off the inevitable. What was I thinking? You can’t make a bargain with entropy. Every system will always tend towards collapse.
Can’t you try recalibrating again?

Isenfel is an artificial environment created to simulate the collapse of E-Space. I’ve triggered the shut-down. And now I can’t stop it.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 104

(USING CONTROLS) Not any more. The closed system is disintegrating, venting its energy out into the rest of this universe.

I’ve already done too much. Don’t you see Nyssa? I thought I was saving the people of Isenfel. Instead, I’ve condemned them all to die!
END OF PART THREE
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 105

TEGAN: Go on. I’1l give Romy a hand getting this lot back down to the village.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 79
NYSSA: Be careful, Tegan.
TEGAN: You too. I’ll be back as soon as I can.
NYSSA: (DEPARTING) And you could ask about getting the TARDIS out the ice!
NYSSA: EXITS ALONG CORRIDOR.
TEGAN: Of course! I’d almost forgotten.
ROMY: You think he will save us, this Doctor of yours?
TEGAN: That’s what he does. Really, he just can’t help himself.
TEGAN: of
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 80
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 43: INT. BALANCING CHAMBER
TINKLING: MACHINERY B/G IN INNER CHAMBER AS DOCTOR AND KARLINA
GUIDE: SKARSGARD OUT.
SKARSGARD: (ROBOTIC FX) Isenfel be constant... Isenfel be constant.
DOCTOR: (LEADING SKARSGARD FROM INNER CHAMBER) That’s it, Karlina. Help me guide him out.
KARLINA: (HELPING DOCTOR) Skarsgard will recover himself... outside the inner sanctum?
DOCTOR: That’s what I’m assuming. If we remove him from the core environment, his programming should revert...
SKARSGARD: (GASPING — SUDDENLY HIMSELF AGAIN) My Queen... My Queen... I am sorry... SO very sorry. You... your family have been deceived all this time. I am not what you thought me to be...
KARLINA: You have nothing to apologise for, Balancer Skarsgard. You are still the same man.
SKARSGARD: But I am not a man. I am no subject of yours my lady.
KARLINA: You are. You are my family’s oldest and truest friend.
DOCTOR: You realise what you’ve been doing? Culling your subjects. Under orders from the people who put these controls in place. But from what I can tell, they’re long gone.
SKARSGARD: I have ordered the deaths of... so many... over generations. It has all been my doing.
DOCTOR: I suppose, in a way, you’ve kept this place going. If life had run riot, everything inside the atmosphere bubble would have just been wiped out.
KARLINA: We obey because that is how our lives have always been here. Listen, Skarsgard. There’s nothing else we could have done.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 81
DOCTOR: That’s the trouble when you’re trapped inside a system. You can’t see any other way...
ICE: DOOR OPENS.
DOCTOR: Ah, Nyssa!
NYSSA: Doctor. You wanted my help?
DOCTOR: Yes. (LEADING NYSSA TO INNER CHAMBER) Excuse us a moment, Karlina. I'll be right back.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 82
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 44: INT. INNER BALANCING CHAMBER (CONTINUOUS)
HOLOGRAPHIC: CONTROLS HUM B/G. NYSSA AND DOCTOR ENTER.
DOCTOR: (LEADING NYSSA TO CONTROLS) I need you to... check my working, as it were.
NYSSA: Me, Doctor? What can I do?
DOCTOR: (USING CONTROLS) Here. It’s all quite logical. Isenfel is an experimental environment. Artificial atmosphere, simulated night and day, locked inside a sealed force-field.
NYSSA: I see. This is the map you were talking about.
HOLOGRAPHIC: MAP ACTIVATES
DOCTOR: You weren’t wrong when you guessed the locals had a limited gene pool. These people are lab rats. Only the laboratory's been abandoned, and the experiment left running.
NYSSA: And what was this... experiment testing?
DOCTOR: I’m not sure. Energy monitoring and conservation? It’s a closed system with automatic controls in place to keep things constant. To maintain this ‘Equilibrium’ that everyone believes in.
NYSSA: (USING CONTROLS) I see. You’ve started a recalibration.
DOCTOR: I think I’ve set the system to stabilise, to allow for everything as it currently stands. Then I can work out how to Switch it off. Just.. look things over and tell me if you agree I’m on the right track.
NYSSA: And what about the TARDIS?
DOCTOR: Ah. (DEMONSTRATING CONTROLS) This is an energy monitor. Now, what do you think is the biggest source of untapped energy in this kingdom?
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 83
NYSSA: Of course!
DOCTOR: Only the system doesn’t recognise it. I thought you might try adjusting the scanners. Carefully.
NYSSA: And what will you be doing in the meantime?
DOCTOR: Talking to Skarsgard. He’s had a shock.
NYSSA: What about Solus, and the interface stabiliser?
DOCTOR: (GOES TO DOORWAY) I’ve not forgotten. — So. You’re happy with what you’ve got to do?
NYSSA: Not ‘happy’ exactly... But I’ll try.
DOCTOR: I know that feeling well. (BEAT) Am I making things better? I don’t know, Nyssa. I just don’t know.
NYSSA: You’re changing things. Surely that’s better than how it was?
DOCTOR: Let’s hope so. (EXITING)
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 84
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 45: EXT. ICE PATH — ON CART
DOCTOR WHO: TEGAN AND ROMY IN HORSE-DRAWN CART. JESPER DRIVING IT ALONG ICE
PATH: THROUGHOUT. CHILD COUGHS AND CRIES.
TEGAN: Uh-oh. I’ve got one being sick back here!
JESPER: (CALLING FROM DRIVER'S SEAT) We fed them too well, I think!
ROMY: Here. (HANDING TEGAN CLOTHS) It is not much further. We ride through the pass and the village is beyond.
TEGAN: (MOPPING UP) I don’t suppose you’ve a change of clothes at your place? For me I mean.
JESPER: Nothing like these strange garments you wear now!
TEGAN: It’d be good to get out of these overalls. Let me guess. I can have anything so long as it’s white fur?
ROMY: The new day is dawning. By the time it is light, the children will be back with their families.
TEGAN: They all handed them over to you willingly?
JESPER: It had to be done quickly before the Balancer was alerted.
TEGAN: But still, they must trust you both.
ROMY: Jesper has been a village elder for many years. And the Princess’s tracker for longer. He is respected.
JESPER: Hush, woman. You are well-loved by the people. Romy’s work in the palace kitchens meant we both had access.
TEGAN: And you kept them there. For years. Right under the Balancer’s nose.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 85
JESPER: We get help from those we trust, but it gets harder. I do not know what we would have done as they grew older.
ROMY: We may not have seen that future. I almost didn’t see this dawn.
TEGAN: Yes. I’m sorry. We’ve brought you a whole load of trouble.
ROMY: No, you bring something else.
JESPER: Something new. Change.
TEGAN: I just hope it’s change for the better.
BABY: CRIES.
TEGAN: Talking of change. (SNIFFS) Anyone got any nappies?
ROMY: I shall attend to it.
TEGAN: Hey. Am I imagining it, or does the sky look a funny colour?
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 86
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 46: INT. BALANCING CHAMBER
HUM: B/G IN INNER CHAMBER AS DOCTOR EMERGES
DOCTOR: Queen Karlina. How is your Balancer?
KARLINA: He went to his quarters.
DOCTOR: Really, I’d rather we kept him close at hand...
KARLINA: Skarsgard needs time to recover himself. I do not fully understand all you have shown us. But his whole life has been torn apart.
DOCTOR: Of course. It’s a lot to take in.
KARLINA: And I have no idea what I should be doing...
DOCTOR: There is something, which may be a welcome distraction.
KARLINA: Yes?
DOCTOR: My craft. It slipped beneath the ice when we arrived.
KARLINA: Beneath the ice? Anything that falls to Isenfel stays on the surface until the black snow takes it.
DOCTOR: Luckily for me, my ship was losing power into the vortex. If it had been the other way around, well, I imagine there’d have been quite a flurry of your black snow.
KARLINA: Losing power?
DOCTOR: But it should have stabilised. It’s down there somewhere. Nyssa is finding out exactly where.
KARLINA: I will have my people assist. We have tools we can use to cut the ice.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 87
DOCTOR: Thank you. And I’ve something else to find too. Something Solus had with him. Perhaps it was left in his shipwreck?
SKARSGARD: (AT DOORWAY) That wreck is gone.
DOCTOR: Skarsgard.
KARLINA: Lord Balancer. Are you rested?
SKARSGARD: (ENTERING) No, my lady. I don’t believe I will ever rest again.
DOCTOR: I realise this must be a difficult time, but it’s vitally important I recover an item that Solus had with him.
SKARSGARD: His vessel is destroyed. Lost to the black snow. But I believe I know the object you seek...
DOCTOR: Then please, will you-
SKARSGARD: (INTERRUPTING) No! First, you will explain to me. Doctor. You who fell to our world with all the answers. First you will tell me.. what I am!
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 88
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 47: EXT. ICE PLAIN
DOCTOR WHO: WATERFALL OF DISTORTION, DISTANT. TURLOUGH AND INGER WALKING
OVER: ICE THROUGH.
TURLOUGH: So that’s how things are run here. It’s rather like a great big petri dish.
INGER: All in Isenfel must be willing to make the sacrifice.
TURLOUGH: It certainly brings families closer. (SOTTO) A lot closer than mine at any rate.
INGER: You think so? I never knew my grandfather. He had to die so I could live. That was his gift to me, and I will not waste it.
TURLOUGH: (STOPPING) Do you think we can rest? There’s been no sign of those beasts. Black or white. And look. It’s getting lighter.
INGER: (STOPPING) I know... But I have never seen a dawn like this one.
TURLOUGH: I don’t know what to expect next in this place...
INGER: Remember, at the edge of the world? The colour changed. It has given the sky a sickly hue.
INGER: WATERFALL OF DISTORTION INCREASES IN PITCH, COMES SLOWLY CLOSER.
INGER: Get up, Sir Turlough. We cannot rest.
TURLOUGH: Please. Just a few minutes-
INGER: No. Not even one. It is still a long way to the palace. And we have no time to spare. Do you not feel it?
TURLOUGH: Feel what?
INGER: The edge of our kingdom is coming closer.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 89
TURLOUGH: The edge of-? (BREAKS OFF, REALISING) Of course... It’s an energy barrier... The TARDIS crossed it to land. That’s what’s surrounding this place...
CRACKLING: DISTORTION OVERHEAD.
INGER: Listen. And look. Lightning that sparks across the sky, never coming to ground. This too is something I have never seen.
TURLOUGH: It could be shorting out. And if the whole energy barrier’s contracting...
INGER: That is what I said. The end of our world is coming closer.
TURLOUGH: (SETTING OFF) You’ve convinced me. Come on, we need to move.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 90
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 48: EXT. VILLAGE
DOCTOR WHO: TEGAN, ROMY AND JESPER WALKING OVER SNOW. A CHILD HAPPILY RUNS TO ITS PARENTS.
TEGAN: That’s it. Everyone from your nursery, reunited with their folks. Happy families.
JESPER: But for how long?
ROMY: We were fools to think we could change anything. That we could go against the Balancing.
TEGAN: The Doctor will think of something. I’m sure he will.
JESPER: We cannot fight the rules of Isenfel. Perhaps we have lived too long already, Romy. Perhaps we should have just made way.
TEGAN: You don’t have any kids yourselves?
ROMY: No. We were never blessed.
JESPER: Or cursed. Since if we had, then one of us...
TEGAN: Yeah. Right. I don’t know how you can live like this.
JESPER: It is all we know.
ROMY: There is no other way. We live with the certainty of death.
TEGAN: But doesn’t that make you want to fight back?
JESPER: It did. But look what happened.
ROMY: We tried. But now we know there is no other way. The Balancing is as constant as the ice beneath our feet. (RESIGNED) Isenfel be constant.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 91
JESPER: (RESIGNED) Isenfel be constant. Follow, Lady Tegan. I shall return you to the palace.
TEGAN: Thanks. Goodbye Romy. I hope we can- (INTERRUPTED)
TEGAN: CRIES OF VILLAGERS, OFF. DISTORTED STATIC OF BLACK SNOW IN DISTANCE.
TEGAN: What is it?
ROMY: Black snow.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 92
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 49: EXT. ICE GARDEN
PEOPLE: WALKING OVER ICE, SCRAPING AND CUTTING INTO ICE.
NYSSA: Thank you for your assistance, your majesty.
KARLINA: The Doctor and Skarsgard have things to discuss. They are best left alone.
NYSSA: I agree. I wasn’t entirely sure what those systems were telling me, but there was definitely something here.
KARLINA: Just outside my palace walls. In our ice gardens.
NYSSA: The sculptures are incredible in their detail.
KARLINA: We were so very proud of our craftsmen. But now, all this art means so... little.
NYSSA: On the contrary, your highness. I can tell everything in Isenfel has meaning to you. The palace itself is a magnificent structure. Elegant in its simplicity. And so very beautiful.
KARLINA: You have a regal bearing, Lady Nyssa. Unlike your friends. Am I right in thinking you are from noble stock?
NYSSA: It’s a very long time ago now. I’ve come to learn it doesn’t really matter who your parents are. It’s what they teach you.
KARLINA: You are wise beyond your years. You and the Doctor, you have the eyes of older souls.
NYSSA: I’m a lot older than I look. The Doctor too. (ASIDE) I’m starting to realise how he sometimes feels. (TO KARLINA) I’ve been travelling for a long time... But I’m ready to stop. That’s where we differ.
KARLINA: You believe in him. As I believed in Skarsgard...
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 93
NYSSA: I do. The Doctor is a good man. He will always try and make a difference.
SHOUTS: OFF.
PEOPLE: Here! I see it!
KARLINA: My hunters have found something.
NYSSA: The energy locater was right. I didn’t believe it at first. We arrived much further out. Beyond those ice-ridges.
KARLINA: My palace has always been at the centre of things. People and things are drawn to it.
NYSSA: Maybe that’s it. While the TARDIS was losing energy, Isenfel’s control systems pulled it in towards the palace so they could work out what it was.
KARLINA: If this machine can do all you claim, then it may prove useful.
NYSSA: Oh yes. The TARDIS can be very useful indeed.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 94
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 50: INT. INNER BALANCING CHAMBER
TINKLING: HOLOGRAPHIC SYSTEMS HUM B/G
DOCTOR: (ENTERING) Follow me. Please. It shouldn’t be such a shock this time.
SKARSGARD: (OUTSIDE) I.. I will not lose myself?
DOCTOR: No. You won’t. You’re part of it, Skarsgard. An artificial construct linked to this control system.
SKARSGARD: Artificial?
DOCTOR: You’re an incredibly complex machine.
SKARSGARD: I am not... alive?
DOCTOR: Not strictly speaking, no. But then again. What’s life, if not an incredibly complex machine?
SKARSGARD: Then... I shall enter. (ROBOTIC FX AS HE ENTERS ROOM) Isenfel be constant.
DOCTOR: You’re doing well, Skarsgard. I think the system reset has run its course.
SKARSGARD: (FX) System recalibrated. Diagnostics running. (BEAT) lI... see... all of Isenfel, through my mind.
DOCTOR: (USING CONTROLS) That’s right. Now, I want to dig a little deeper into the core programming. (BEAT) I’m afraid this may hurt.
SKARSGARD: (FX) If I am a machine, how do I feel pain?
DOCTOR: Your neural circuits will experience a huge surge of power. Think of your heart as a perpetual motion machine. It’s meant to keep you running for thousands of years.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 95
SKARSGARD: (FX) I have... excess energy? How does this not disturb the balance?
DOCTOR: You’re the monitor. You’re outside the parameters of the system. I need to give your workings a jolt to see them clearly.
SKARSGARD: (FX) This ‘jolt’ will... cause pain?
DOCTOR: I’m afraid so, yes. I have to access the shell program. There’s something behind it. A message.
SKARSGARD: (FX) Do it, Doctor. Discover the truth.
DOCTOR: All right. And I’m really very sorry... (ACTIVATES CONTROLS )
SKARSGARD: (FX) CRIES OUT IN PAIN
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 96
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 51: EXT. VILLAGE
VILLAGERS: PANICKING. CRYING IN FEAR. RUNNING OVER ICE. STATIC DISTORT OF BLACK SNOW BLIZZARD.
VILLAGERS: (B/G PANIC) Help! Save us! We are lost!
JESPER: I’ve never seen the black snow fall so thick.
TEGAN: It’s like it’s deliberately attacking the village.
ROMY: It has come for us. We have brought this on ourselves...
TEGAN: Can’t we get inside? Under cover!
JESPER: There’s nowhere to go. It’s all around. The huts will dissolve like everything else!
TEGAN: Everything...? (REMEMBERING) But not the palace! We need to get everyone back up to the palace.
ROMY: The children. This is happening because we brought the children outside...
JESPER: No, this storm is bigger than any I’ve seen before. Those few small lives cannot be the cause.
TEGAN: I thought the Doctor reset everything. That it would all get... balanced out.
ROMY: Even your Doctor cannot fight the constancy of Isenfel.
JESPER: Load the carts. Lady Tegan is right. (CALLING) Everyone. Run, ride, flee! Go back through the mountain pass. Do not stop. We must rely on the mercy of our queen.
PEOPLE: START TO RUSH TO DEPART.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 97
ROMY: Our village... Our lives. They are being laid waste. (BEAT) We have caused this. It is all my fault.
JESPER: Romy! No!
ROMY: (WALKING AWAY) Even one life can make a difference!
TEGAN: What are you doing? Don’t walk towards it!
JESPER: Romy, Please! Don’t leave me...
ROMY: (CALLING) I love you Jesper. But you live for both of us now... Aaargh! (SCREAMS AS SHE DISSOLVES IN STATIC DISTORT)
JESPER: Romy! (SOBS) Stupid... stupid woman. How can I live without you?
TEGAN: She’s gone, Jesper. I’m sorry. She’s gone. (BEAT) The blizzard’s stopped moving. She’s given everyone a chance.
JESPER: I will follow her into the storm. That’s what I must do.
TEGAN: GRABS HIM.
TEGAN: No you won’t. You’ll fight. And right now you’re going to get
TEGAN: me a horse.
JESPER: A horse?
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 98
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 52: EXT. ICE PLAIN
CRACKLING: DISTORTION IN THE SKY, A DISTANT WATERFALL OF
DISTORTION: CLOSES IN.
INGER: (STOPPING) Stop... a moment...
TURLOUGH: (STOPPING) Let’s catch our breath.
INGER: Look. The edge of our world is following us.
TURLOUGH: I don’t think it’s personal. You can see it moving now. Something must have happened to make it start closing in.
INGER: We always live with the certainty of death. If our time is over, if our world decides we are finished, then perhaps-
TURLOUGH: What happened to not wasting what your grandfather gave you?
INGER: Isenfel may deem that debt repaid. The Balancing decides, not I.
TURLOUGH: Well, I’m not giving up quite so easily.
INGER: Here in Isenfel, we accept the inevitable.
TURLOUGH: Well, I’m not from Isenfel, and death is something I plan to put off for as long as possible. Come on!
TURLOUGH: THEY SET OFF RUNNING AGAIN.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 99
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 53: INT. INNER BALANCING CHAMBER
DOCTOR WHO: TINKLING AND HUMMING CONTROLS SYSTEMS ACTIVATING.
DOCTOR: That’s it. I’ve got something. A record file. Skarsgard — how
DOCTOR: how do I get this to play...?
SKARSGARD: (ROBOTIC FX) Activate.
SCREEN: ACTIVATES.
VIKTOR: (ECHOEY RECORDING PLAYBACK ON-SCREEN, DISTORTED, BROKEN, SKIPPING) Isenfel Experimental environment - (HISS) - closed system simulation — (HISS) - to allow energy venting within parameters — (HISS) - create internal entropy fields — (SKIPPING) — in case of emergency, the life-forms can adapt to remove excess — (HISS)
DOCTOR: A recording. Of course. Any good scientist makes notes. But this is very old... it’s been corrupted.
VIKTOR: (D) — the record of Experimenter Viktor Skarsgard.
DOCTOR: See, Balancer? You’re modelled on the original experimenter. You did have the voice of God after all.
VIKTOR: (D, PLAYBACK STABILISES) We have created this system and seeded it with life to investigate our theory. Our universe is collapsing. And the rate of decay is much quicker than anticipated. By simulating this collapse we can discover more about the eventual fate of our universe.
DOCTOR: Now we’re getting somewhere.
DOCTOR: FAST-FORWARDING OF RECORDING.
VIKTOR: (D) Record nine zero three. The experiment is over. We have turned our attention instead to means of escape. We believe there may be a passage to external universes.. Isenfel has been a glorious failure.
VIKTOR: EXTENDED ‘END-OF-MESSAGE’ BEEP.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 100
SKARSGARD: (FX) System wipe.
DOCTOR: What? (AT CONTROLS, DISMAYED) No. Why are you doing that?
SKARSGARD: (FX) Entropy protocols engaged. All energy venting. Isenfel experimental environment, shutting down.
DOCTOR: Oh no.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 101
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 54: EXT. VILLAGE ROAD
BLACK: SNOW DISTORT B/G. VILLAGERS MOVING OUT ALONG ICE-PATH WITH CARTS, HORSES.
TEGAN: (LEADING HORSE) Right. Give me a leg up, Jesper.
JESPER: Lars says this stallion is good-tempered. It should serve you well. (HELPING TEGAN MOUNT) You are sure, Lady Tegan?
TEGAN: (SETTLING HERSELF ON SADDLE) I’m sure all right. Romy bought us some time. You need to get your people away, and I need to find my friend. He’s lost out there somewhere.
JESPER: You don’t know where.
TEGAN: I can follow tracks in the snow. The hunt left enough of a trail. No-one else was heading their way last night.
JESPER: If you cannot be turned from this...
TEGAN: No. I can’t. (BEAT) Thanks Jesper. I know it’s hard losing Romy like that. But we’ve got to look after the ones still here. You can mourn her later.
JESPER: You are right, Lady Tegan. Go, and may Isenfel grant you the
JESPER: time.
TEGAN: Good luck to you too! Yah! (SPURS HORSE ON)
TEGAN: GALLOPS OFF.
JESPER: (TO SELF) I am sick of death’s victories this night. I will not see it win another.
JESPER: RUNS TOWARDS OTHERS.
JESPER: (CALLING) Lars! Fetch me a horse!
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 102
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 55: EXT. ICE PLAIN
DOCTOR WHO: INGER AND TURLOUGH RUNNING. A WATERFALL OF DISTORTION FOLLOWS
INGER: The palace... I see the palace at last.
TURLOUGH: Good. Because I’d swear that barrier is moving faster.
INGER: And look. It is not just closing in. See what is spilling from ao
TURLOUGH: Oh no, our black furry friends are back. In force.
MANY: BLACK SNOWBEASTS ROARING AND SNARLING IN DISTANCE.
INGER: Come on!
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 103
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 56: INT. INNER BALANCING CHAMBER
HOLOGRAPHIC: SYSTEMS AND ALARMS TINKLING AND HUMMING, BUILDING THROUGH IN B/G.
DOCTOR: (SHAKING SKARSGARD) Come on... Skarsgard! Speak to me!
DOCTOR: DASHES TO CONTROL BANKS. NYSSA RUNS IN.
NYSSA: (CALLING) Doctor! We’ve found the TARDIS! It got dragged in towards central control. They’re digging for it in the palace garden!
DOCTOR: (DISTRACTED, HITTING CONTROLS) Good... good. Though that’s rather like finding a deflated lifejacket on the Titanic...
NYSSA: What’s wrong? What’s happened to the Balancer?
DOCTOR: He’s stopped responding. (CROSSING TO OTHER CONTROLS) And Isenfel’s bubble is shrinking.
NYSSA: The energy transduction barrier, you mean? I thought you’d stabilised everything.
DOCTOR: (RUNNING TO ANOTHER CONTROL BANK) So did I. But it seems all I managed to do was stave off the inevitable. What was I thinking? You can’t make a bargain with entropy. Every system will always tend towards collapse.
NYSSA: Can’t you try recalibrating again?
DOCTOR: It seems any process within the experiment can be run once and once only.
NYSSA: What do you mean?
DOCTOR: Isenfel is an artificial environment created to simulate the collapse of E-Space. I’ve triggered the shut-down. And now I can’t stop it.
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 104
NYSSA: There’s nothing you can do?
DOCTOR: (USING CONTROLS) Not any more. The closed system is disintegrating, venting its energy out into the rest of this universe.
NYSSA: There must be something!
DOCTOR: I’ve already done too much. Don’t you see Nyssa? I thought I was saving the people of Isenfel. Instead, I’ve condemned them all to die!
DOCTOR: END OF PART THREE
DOCTOR WHO: EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 105

elements.text: PART FOUR
NO REPRISE
SCENE 57: EXT. ICE PLAIN
B/G DISTANT FIZZING DISTORTION OF ENERGY BARRIER SHRINKING.
TURLOUGH AND INGER CLIMB OVER RIDGE
(STOPPING, CALLING BACK) Nearly there, Sir Turlough! Over this ridge and the palace is below us.
(CATCHING UP) There’s the mountain pass. The way we set off. We’ve come round in a circle. Hold on... Look at all the people.
They’re marching on the palace! — What is this? Revolution?
No. I think they’re saving themselves. Look what’s behind them.
Black snowstorms, sweeping over the ice-plains.
While we’ve got black snowbeasts and the edge of the world after us. We need to warn them what else is coming.
THEY START SLIPPING AND SLIDING DOWN RIDGE.
EQUILIBRIUM (FINAL) Page 106
SCENE 58: INT. INNER BALANCING CHAMBER
MACHINERY WHIRRING OUT OF CONTROL. DOCTOR RUSHES
CONTROL PANELS TRYING TO STOP THE PROCESS.
It’s no use, Nyssa. The forces keep changing. I’m trying to secure the integrity of the atmosphere bubble, but it’s impossible to find a balance!
Can’t you reverse what you’ve done, put the system back to how it was?
I can’t do anything, Nyssa! Reverse it, accelerate it, switch it off! All the protocols are locked.
Doctor. The TARDIS.
What about it?
Queen Karlina’s people will have it out of the ice soon.
We can’t just leave! Even if we wanted to, the [stabiliser]-
(INTERRUPTING) But we could shelter! There’s nothing more we can do here. Is there?
